title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Short analysis on Jean - Pierre Jeunet"s Le fabuleux destin d"Amélie Poulain For 20 years Jean - Pierre Jeunet collected small astonishing and intriguing moments in his life , taking notes in his diary , not knowing that he was up to co - write and direct one of the most successful film in French film history .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Jean - Pierre Jeunet fell in love with the story and the film he titled Le fabuleux destin d"Amélie Poulain .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: But it"s popularity was even a surprise to Jean - Pierre Jeunet himself as he once stated : ` I guess I have to produce a film like Alien Resurrection ( USA 1997 ) to make a movie like Le fabuleux destin d"Amélie Poulain " , obviously not aware of the films potential .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Unfortunately the film didn"t win an Academy Award for the best foreign film in 2001 which still puzzles film fans all over the world .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: I consider Jean - Pierre Jeunet"s film as a masterpiece .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: In my opinion , it is an outstanding film in film history for its cinematography , the music , the story , but above all the overall atmosphere .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Going to the cinema is like meditating .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: We sit for over one - hour and comfortable chair - our breath slows down

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: and as the lights are switched off , we enter a dream world .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: We seek to escape our normal world just for a short period of time , to experience something totally different

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: and yet , we want to find ourselves in this world .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Thanks to Jean - Pierre Jeunet I had a wonderful dream , I will never forget .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Jean - Pierre Jeunet and his camera man , Bruno Delbonnel , wanted to make the film look like the Spanish painter did his artwork .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: To establish a dreamlike atmosphere they used mostly red and green , sometimes adding a little blue spot in the picture to set the contrast .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Audrey Tautou ( Amélie Poulain ) , mostly wears either red or green dresses , as well as the housekeeper ( Yolande Moreau as Madelaine Wallace , concierge ) ,

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: and Amélie"s mother ( Lorella Cravotta as Amandine Poulin ) in the beginning of the film .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: When Amélie Poulain sits down to watch the tragedy of her life on her TV , there is an outstanding of a blue lamp in the background .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Sometimes the use of color gets very obvious .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Amélie"s apartment for example is almost completely red , the underground station and the train station are kept in green

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: and the green grocery store stands out from the grey buildings .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Honestly , I haven"t noticed the extreme use of color the first time I watched the movie .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: I just wondered how Jeunet succeeded in establishing such a fabulous atmosphere .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: The atmosphere is also supported by the magnificent music by Yann Tiersen who has composed 19 songs in 15 days for this movie .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: The principal motive appears in many variations somehow being joyful ,

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: yet at the same time sad - slow and sometimes fast and activating .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: The music supports every moment in the film

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: and becomes the sound of a fabulous world .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Camera movement certainly contributes its part to the atmosphere .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Balanced and unbalanced pictures contribute to the message of each shot .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Right in the beginning when Amélie"s mother is introduced , the picture is balanced symbolizing her pursuit for correctness and cleanliness .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: The same can be about the first shots of Amélie"s father .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: When talking about his dislikes , the shots are unbalanced .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: But more impressing are some camera movements .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: For example there is an astonishing high angle shot of Amélie flipping stones on le canal in Paris .

review: The camera shows her leaning on a fence , flying above her head then craning to a low angle shot to show her flipping stones in the direction of the camera .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...

review: Nino is shown falling up the steps chasing the repairs person for the photo machines .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: The camera turns to show the man getting in the car driving off .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Still in a low angle Nino starts his moped , trying to follow the worker , almost hitting a car .

title: It's my favorite movie of all time...
review: Amélie is entering the picture running after Nino .

review: The camera follows her , then turning almost 180 ° around her to show her hold Nino"s red bag that he lost .

review: A simple smile on the old"s man face , a close - up of Amélie"s hand letting the copied key slide into her pocket and the heart beat as a background sound would have done the same without disturbing the atmosphere .

review: Anyway , Le fabuleux destin d"Amélie Poulain is still my favorite movie .

review: but it fails because it tries too hard : The exaggerated camera movements and sound effects , the ultra - luminous ( yet rather nice ) cinematography designed to turn Paris into a fantasy world , the odd quips of dialogue on orgasms , but the absolute biggest fault of the film is with the lead character known as Amelie .

review: Amelie is a woman - child who likes to take it upon herself to do selfless good deeds for everyone around her ,

review: and the entire storyline revolves around her attempts to fix various problems for everyone within her vicinity .

title: Insufferably Annoying
review: The only problem is that Amelie"s selflessness isn"t real , she"s only doing this to feed her own sense of accomplishment so she can crack that god - awful smile at the camera once that good deed is done .

title: Insufferably Annoying
review: Not long after it becomes extremely apparent that she"s a psychopath who breaks into other people"s appartments to screw with them ( because she , not the police or any authorities , must be the one to deal with bad people ) , appoints herself as an unneeded tour guide for a blind man and basically does whatever she wants , regardless of whether it actually helps anyone .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: * * very mild spoilers * * I rented " Amelie " reluctantly .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: I had the impression that it would be a " girlie " film with meandering narrative and boring angst - ridden characters .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: I am so glad I was wrong ! What I did get was a " magical realism " tale of an introverted woman trying to improve the lives of the people around her .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: Amelie , through clever scheming and gentle intervention , facilitates delightful life experiences for her fellow characters .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: The film does move at a slower pace ,

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: but the plot points are endearing , and it never drags .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: Every scene has a subtextual significance , where every shot adds a tiny sense of guilty voyeurism as we peek gentle into these people"s lives .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: The plot devices are purposely stretched to fantastical lengths at times .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: Laurant and Jeunet use this " magical " aspect of the realism to cultivate an optimism and effervescence that you won"t find in any Hollywood movie today .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: The mood is always dreamy in this film ,

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: yet is never childish .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: The characters will warm your heart .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: Audrey Tatou is perfect as the shy - yet - smouldering Amelie ,

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: and Jamel Debbouze is perfect as the impish Lucien .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: You will love the sub plots of Amelie convincing her father to travel ,

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: and how she seeks gentle vengeance on the wicked grocer .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: The scheme to introduce herself to Nino ,

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: and the plot to do matchmaking at the cafe .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: All of these little stories are bound to tweak your heartstrings ! In the end : Amelie will leave you with feeling that " Pay it Forward " should have left you with ... A buoyant and optimistic affection for humanity and life ! I highly recommend this movie to anyone , whether you are an action fan , an intellectual , or a feel - good Hollywood movie buff .

title: Magical Realism for a cynical world...
review: There are clever plot elements and characterization that are good for all movie fans ! 9 kernels of popcorn out of 10 .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: Spoilers herein . I avoided this film for ever - so - long because of what I had heard about it .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: One would believe that this is a well - photographed simple sweet story .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: That somehow it has something to do with the adventures of a sweet girl - woman . Well , it is .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: But it is so much else , and that ` something else " not only makes the sickly sweetness tolerable -- it completely undermines it .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: That"s because every film rests on three threads that connect between it and us the viewers .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: The first thread is the story , which many people -- even filmmakers -- would have you believe is either all there is or at least that it is paramount .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: The second thread -- more visceral and immediate -- is the cinematic presentation .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: This filmmaker has wisely chosen to make the visual space coincide with the fondly imagined nostalgia of a simple past .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: All is simple , clean , abstract , sweet .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: Even Paris , whose primary products are dog poop and meanspirited grafitti .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: But that third thread is the most important -- even more powerful , perhaps because of its subliminal nature .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: And it is here that this film is rooted ,

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: and the rooting is superb , intelligent .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: That root is George Perec , probably France"s most influential writer .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: Not the most known or best loved , he directly approached a problem of the French character : that they were once an important people artistically .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: How does one be creative in a land populated by dead , giant saints ? You build metastructures of the structures already there -- you build stories about stories .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: The component stories can be as trite as the public demands ,

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: but the assembly -- the structure of which eludes the casual viewer -- can be as clever as you wish .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: In 1978 , Perec published a large book called ` Life , a User"s Manual .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: " It is a wonderful work which every literately educated person should encounter .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: It answers the question ` what can a writer do after Robbes - Grille ? " ( which is roughly the same question as what can a French filmmaker do after the ` new wave ? " ) This film is very closely based on that book in both form and content .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: The book is a collection of several hundred stories , many of the type ` at this precise moment , Jacques was removing sand from his toenails ( the location of the beach perhaps being a setting for the previous story ) and recalling the sand on the photographs he took of his honeymoon in Chartres where Jeanette first saw his feet

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: and said she fell in love with them alone ... " All these stories are triggered or anchored in some physical detail , like a box left by a child in the wall , or a torn photograph on the floor of a train station .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: , or a lamp in the form a character .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: Most of these stories involve unnecessary losses , small decisions of great consequence or attempts to represent and/or assemble the other stories in a personal context .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: The book"s central organizing device was an apartment building in the same location in Paris as the film .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: There are so many characters and stories that the book provides diagrams .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: Elements from the book in the movie ( as I recall ): images that are torn and reassembled , a painter painting the same scene over and over , a found child"s treasurebox , a simpleminded son , a ` glass man , " images from all over the world , a funhouse , a fine meal disguised .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: Minor mysteries solved ( the image is of a repairman ) , characters who are recorders ( the jealous boyfriend with his tape , the painter with his VCR , the maintainer of the photobooths , the stewardess who photographs the gnome ) characters who create reality ( the girl who imagines both reality and films on the TeeVee , the man who is the ` designated mourner " for reconstructed images , the painter who is reinventing Amelie ) .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: The wind caused two glasses to dance ; the important thing here is the wind , not the glasses .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: If you have not seen this , please do .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: But see the story as deliberately facile and trite , intended to only be pieces that should be assembled by you to make a real picture .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: Anyone who thinks this is a just a sweet story should have their license to view films revoked .

title: Life, A User's Manual
review: Ted"s Evaluation -- 3 of 4 : Worth watching .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: I"ve heard numerous people go on about how " Amelie " represents a " revival of French cinema .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: " If this is true , then the future of French film looks a lot dimmer than even the most pessimistic Francophile could have guessed .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: Like " Delicatessen " and " The City of Lost Children , " " Amelie " is a stunningly made film , with wonderful music and some awe - inspiring visuals .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: But this is supposed to be a narrative - driven film ,

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: and the film falls flat here .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: The plot could basically be described as Jane Austen"s " Emma " meets Dreyer"s " Gertrud " meets a theme park ride , as a succession of episodes follows Amelie"s search for true love , in the process helping others in their own quests , blah blah blah .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: If this doesn"t sound like enough to maintain a 130 - minute film , you"re right , and even though the actors try their best , the movie runs out of tricks after just half - an - hour and plods along for the remainder in an entirely predictable pattern you"ve seen a million times in hackneyed Hollywood romances .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: This pedestrian storyline takes place against a complete fantasy world with absolutely no resemblance to the " real " world ,

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: but unlike " Delicatessen " and " The City of Lost Children , " Jeunet tries to ground it somehow in reality , setting it in both a specific location ( the Montmarte district of Paris ) and at a specific time ( 1997 , around the same time as Princess Di"s death , which in Jeunet"s Disneyfied Montmarte is the only world event of any significance ) .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: This renders the entire " fairy tale " approach ( complete with wistful narrator ) moot -- " once upon a time " has no meaning when the storyteller goes to such lengths to place his tale in an actual place and time .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: So why the colorful , gussied - up , theme - park aesthetic that dominates the film ? It appears that Jeunet simply does so for the purposes of nostalgia , to harken back to the " gay Paree " image that in all likelihood never existed and certainly doesn"t today .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: Whereas the real Montmarte is heavily populated by impoverished immigrants , Jeunet"s is as white as a Republican Party convention ,

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: and the one token minority character , an Arab , is as French as de Gaulle .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: Sanitation problems don"t exist in this Montmarte , nor for that matter do fast - food restaurants , chain stores , or any other symbols of modern society .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: Even the beggars are happy and content .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: Intentionally or not , there is something quite reactionary about the world view Jeunet presents us with ,

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: and the occasional pseudo - documentary flourish doesn"t change one jot the fact that nothing in the film is " real .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: " Jeunet has dismissed this criticism , saying that his film is not about the social problems of today but about the struggles and triumphs of " the little guy .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: " How can you not like that ? But in the real world , " the little guys " are impoverished , overwhelmingly non - white workers living in abject squalor , more concerned with where their next meal is coming from than with finding " true love .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: " These people don"t exist for Jeunet , so his smarmy claim of sticking up for those who can"t stick up for themselves is a self - serving fraud .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: To sum up , " Ameile " is a visually gorgeous film with some fine performances , all of which are negated by the insipid and unoriginal purposes they"re used for .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: If Jeunet had the guts to take the premise

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: and set it in something at least approximating the real world , this would"ve been an interesting stylistic experiment , along the lines of Godard"s " neo - realist musical " " A Woman Is a Woman .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: " But Jeunet ( who despises both the directors of the nouvelle vague and the neo - realist movement ) seems to have prostrated himself before commerical success ,

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: and in the process produced a work little better than the mega - budget , star - driven garbage pumped out on a routine basis by Hollywood .

title: A bad sign for French cinema
review: French cinema can do better than this .

title: STALKER!
review: OK , everyone seemed so impressed with this film that I decided to check it out .

title: STALKER!
review: Then after reflecting on the absolute blubbering and swooning that most people did about this film I decided to register with IMDB and just see if there might be anyone in agreement with me ? Sure the film making is wonderful .

title: STALKER!
review: Sure it"s sort of non - banal escapism .

title: STALKER!
review: Sure it"s " not like anything else seen before , "

title: STALKER!
review: but it seems that what almost everyone reviewing this film is enamored is the " cute factor " and ignoring what is screamingly obvious .

title: STALKER!
review: The lead character , is apparently a cute , little stalker of a girl , with a plucky ,

title: STALKER!
review: yet dogged tenacity , and a sheepish grin .

title: STALKER!
review: Sure , no one is murdered in a particularly heinous fashion ,

title: STALKER!
review: and the musical score never once makes you bristle and feel like what she is doing is out of line ,

title: STALKER!
review: but take Audrey Tautou out of the lead and give it to someone like oh say , Roseanne Barr - Arnold , and the tenor of the film gets really dark really quickly .

title: STALKER!
review: Or just reverse the sexes of the lead actors in the film for that matter .

title: STALKER!
review: It"s seems odd to me that the newest criminal blight de jour is stalking , (

title: STALKER!
review: and not just the headline grabbing celebrity stalking , )

title: STALKER!
review: and everyone is up in arms if an ex - lover , romantic , " admirer " , or frequent passerby ( stalker by today"s standards ) so much as breathes out of line in regards to their said " target " and they are immediately banished to the fringes of society or locked away .

title: STALKER!
review: But put a happy little face on it and some devilishly cute eyes and perhaps some long sexy legs

title: STALKER!
review: and everyone is ready to forgive her stalking actions and attribute it to delightful eccentricity and / or whimsy .

title: STALKER!
review: This movie is definitely a mixed message .

title: STALKER!
review: In the present political climate , it"s best to take heed of what messages you take in and not to take them at face value but to look deeper and see what the real message is .

title: STALKER!
review: The screamingly apparent message of this movie is that if you are cute and sprite - ful , you can be a stalker , win the target of your obsession , and get away with it .

title: STALKER!
review: And the funniest thing is , everyone seems to have ignored the fact that that is THE major theme in this film , and because of the stylistic film making , they have just fallen head over heels in love with it and completely ignored the face value substance of the film .

review: If stalking is cute , change the laws in your state .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: Frank Zappa had it just about right with that above quote ,

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: and if you"re not laughing you"ve obviously never been to the REAL France ( and stepped in some of the ever - present dog - doo on the sidewalks over there , or dealt with some of the " rude , snobbish & bizarrely hostile behavior " that seems as natural as breathing air to more than a few people over there ) , or had blinders on when you did go there , inspired by the FANTASY Paris of charming little virtuoso films like " Amelie .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: " Now , in all fairness to the film , it does contain some very intense and hilarious satire in its first half ( though of the much - too - exaggerated " over - the - top " semi - fantasy kind ) & is obviously the work of a CINEMATIC virtuoso ( which does not imply Jeunet is an ARTISTIC virtuoso also , it only means the guy is a complete master of the TECHNICAL possibilities of the medium ) ,

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: but the splitting of the film between satire & irreverence on the one hand & the most cliched of schmaltzified romances on the other , seriously hurts the film"s effectiveness as a possibly DEEPLY SIGNIFICANT piece of ART - ifact .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: It starts off majestically & ends up as CHARMING - SATIRE - MINUS - FLUFF , unlike " THE MAN WHO WASN"T THERE " by the Coen Brothers , which starts off majestically dark & ends an awe - inspiring confirmation of the maxim behind every great " realist " film : Pascal"s famous " Man"s greatness is so obvious it can even be deduced from his wretchedness .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: " Now , I mention the Coens " film because it is the only film I"ve seen this year with CINEMATOGRAPHY ( courtesy of Mr. Roger Deakins ) matching or maybe even surpassing the INSANELY MAGNIFICENT level of the one in display in shot after shot in " Amelie " by BRUNO DELBONNEL .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: I was truly knocked out of my seat by the unerring beauty of the angles used & the antique - look - contrasting - with - modern colors within the shots .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: I also mention the Coens , because Jeunet is making films now that are sort of " Raising - Arizonaish " in their comic - book - imposed - on - reality extravagant , comic style ,

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: but will hopefully achieve the maturity of the Coens , in his deeper outlook to turn out something like " The Man Who Wasn"t There .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: " Getting down to more specifics , " Amelie " reminded me of Louis Malle"s classic 1960 film " Zazie Dans Le Metro , " which also is split down the middle , magnificent for the first half , BORING & cliched in the second .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: However , Catherine Demongeot ( who , bizarrely enough , Nabokov once said would"ve been the PERFECT LOLITA had he been allowed to pick one young enough to add the proper amount of repulsion to Kubrick"s film ) in " Zazie " is a 10 year old girl , & much less interesting to red - blooded heterosexual hairy - chested men ( such as yours truly ) than the supercute , " BIG SHOED " ( above as we ; ; as below ) , starlet of Jeunet"s film : Audrey Tautou .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: On one level , the film is a love affair between Jeunet"s camera & Tautou , in the time honored tradtion of Sternberg / Dietrich , Powell / Kerr , Hitchcock / Hedren , Godard / Karina , De Palma / Nancy Allen , etc .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: , the angles he uses , the way he frames her , the endless close - ups , all of these things are the work of an artist in love with his subject ( whether there"s a " love relatonship " in " real life " is beside the point ) ,

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: and all the audience is thankful for it .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: On another level ( again reminding me of " Zazie " ) , the film takes you on quite a TURBOCHARGED , non - cliched " tour " of picturesque areas of Paris , & is maybe the best advertising the old " city of Romance " has had for years .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: It takes the eyes & sensibilities of masters like Jeunet & Delbonnel to get these shots with just the proper amount of irreverence incoroporated ( by what they choose to show and omit ) , & then ruin them by overplaying sappy annoying accordion music for way too long towards the latter , weaker third of the flick .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: All in all , 3 out of 5 stars or a 7 on a scale of 10 , which means DEFINITELY RECOMMENDED ,

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: but like another technically dazzling , relatively popular French film before it Patrice Leconte"s " The Girl on the Bridge , " a little too short on substance and TRUE ROMANCE ( as opposed to the cliched , NON - EXISTENT kind displayed in the film ; check out Renoir"s " Picnic on the Grass " or Jacques Becker"s " Antoine et Antoinette " if you want to see a similarly whimsical , semi - fantasy film nevertheless displaying the EXISTENT KIND OF " ROMANCE " IN INNER SENSIBILITY if not in actual , same - story realistic possibility ) to give the " HELL OF FRANCE " its proper artistic due ,

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: and in consequence become as great as let"s say Truffaut"s " Shoot the Piano Player .

title: "THERE IS NO HELL, THERE'S ONLY FRANCE."
review: " And did I mention that a sizeable portion of the film is , among other things , a dead - on satire of Hitchcock"s overrated classic " Rear Window " ?

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: Amélie ( Original French title : Le Fabuleux Destin d"Amélie Poulain aka The Fabulous Destiny of Amélie Poulain ) is a romantic comedy film directed by Jean - Pierre Jeunet .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: Written by Jeunet with Guillaume Laurant , the film is a whimsical depiction of contemporary Parisian life , set in Montmartre .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: It tells the story of a shy waitress , played by Audrey Tautou , who decides to change the lives of those around her for the better , while struggling with her own isolation .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: The film was an International co - production between companies in France and Germany .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: Amélie Poulain is a young woman who had grown up isolated from other children .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: After the death of her mother and her father"s subsequent withdrawal , she developed an unusually active imagination to ward away the feelings of loneliness .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: Now at the age of twenty - three , Amélie is a waitress at Café des 2 Moulins , a small café in Montmartre that is staffed and frequented by a collection of eccentrics .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: Having spurned romantic relationships following a few disappointing efforts , she finds contentment in simple pleasures

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: and letting her imagination roam free .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: She is a young woman who had a decidedly unusual childhood ; misdiagnosed with an unusual heart condition , Amelie didn"t attend school with other children ,

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: but spent most of her time in her room , where she developed a keen imagination and an active fantasy life .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: Her mother Amandine died in a freak accident when Amelie was eight ,

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: and her father Raphael had limited contact with her , since his presence seemed to throw her heart into high gear .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: Despite all this , Amelie has grown into a healthy and beautiful young woman who works in a cafe and has a whimsical , romantic nature .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: When Princess Diana dies in a car wreck in the summer of 1997 , Amelie is reminded that life can be fleeting

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: and she decides it"s time for her to intervene in the lives of those around her , hoping to bring a bit of happiness to her neighbors and the regulars at the cafe .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: Amelie starts by bringing together two lonely people -- Georgette , a tobacconist with a severe case of hypochondria , and Joseph , an especially ill - tempered customer .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: When Amelie finds a box of old toys in her apartment , she returns them to their former owner , Mr. Bretodeau , sending him on a reverie of childhood .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: Amelie befriends Dufayel , an elderly artist living nearby whose bones are so brittle , thanks to a rare disease , that everything in his flat must be padded for his protection .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: And Amelie decides someone has to step into the life of Nino , a lonely adult video store clerk and part - time carnival spook - show ghost who collects pictures left behind at photo booths around Paris .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: The feel - good Amelie is a lively , fanciful charmer , showcasing Audrey Tautou as its delightful heroine .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: The sunniest face and the greatest acclaim belong to Tautou , who is new to these shores .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: A delight in the title role , she"s like a young Audrey Hepburn , making us laugh

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: and feel empathy without feeling manipulated .

title: Viewing Amelie Is A Rewarding Experience
review: Finally , Jeunet"s film is an ambitious , rich , and rewarding experience , packed end - to - end with delightful creativity .

title: Amazing
review: The plot revolves around a young French waitress named Amelie ( hence the title ) who , after an incident involving Princess Diana , a bathroom tile and a perfume bottle cap , decides to enrich the lives of those around her .

title: Amazing
review: The result is a hilarious and wonderful story as Amelie ( brilliantly portrayed by Audrey Tautou , who made me an instant fan of hers ) continues to make the lives of her colleagues and friends happier .

title: Amazing
review: However , she becomes so busy doing this that she forgets about her own happiness .

title: Amazing
review: She falls in love with a strange young man called Nino ,

title: Amazing
review: and plays small games to catch his attention , but always ends up backing out just when she has the chance to finally confront him .

title: Amazing
review: With beautiful cinematography and an Oscar - worthy screenplay which was cruelly stolen by Gosford Park , Amelie is a must - see ... As soon as you can ! You will not regret watching this ,

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: ( contains spoilers ) As a sometimes fan of French cinema I really wanted to like this film .

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: However , I was very disappointed at the awful mess of a movie that I was confronted with .

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: Underneath it"s over - indulgent , sickly sweet stomach turning topping , lay a deeply ambiguous film .

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: Amelie"s meddling with other people"s lives was perhaps the most disturbing part of the film .

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: For example , when she constructs a letter from a character"s dead husband we are meant to see this as a good act .

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: However , this is a terribly cruel thing to do to someone ,

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: and if the falsity of this letter became apparent , it would destroy this woman for a second time .

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: Which brings us to the question : is it better to believe a consoling lie or a difficult truth ? We should be free to make such a decision for ourselves ,

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: but Amelie in effect takes this decision away from the woman .

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: Amelie"s punishment of another character in the film is also difficult to swallow .

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: Why should she take it upon herself to punish other people , where is her authority ? The film also suffers from a plethora of frankly unnecessary visual effects , which diminish the story still further .

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: Conclusion : Terrible , terrible , terrible film .

title: A MORALLY AMBIGIOUS, SPITEFUL MESS OF A FILM.
review: 1/10 ( It gets a 1 for the great soundtrack ) .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: Due to a sheltered home life and a misguided father who believed his daughter to have a heart defect , title character Amelie ( Audrey Tautou ) grows up lacking self confidence and an inability to express her true feelings .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: However she can work magic in other people"s lives by doing anonymous good deeds on their behalf ,

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: and the joy she receives by these acts are an inspiration to her .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: What Amelie needs is a guardian angel of her own ,

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: and that"s provided by the wisdom of Raymond Dufayel , the Glass Man ( Serge Merlin ) , who has painted the same picture over and over again for two decades .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: He just can"t get the face of one of his characters quite right , because he"s attempting to capture a fulfilled and happy Amelie ,

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: and she"s just not cooperating , though not for lack of trying .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: Ultimately , this is a warm and joyful film ,

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: and the performance of Tautou as the main character is charming and graceful .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: I rather enjoyed the subtle twist provided by the early mention of how the death of Princess Diana changed the life of Amelie forever .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: But it"s not what one expects .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: Her discovery of a former tenant"s collection of childhood mementos leads her on a mission to reunite him with his lost treasure .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: Seeing his reaction has a profound effect on Amelie ,

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: and sets her on a mission that brings happiness and joy to friends and co - workers .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: But what of Amelie herself - does she not deserve some happiness of her own ? The film takes some clever turns on it"s way to fulfilling Amelie"s quest .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: The picture works I think , because so many people find themselves relating to her character , anxious on the one hand to make a move ,

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: and afraid to do so because of possible rejection .

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: One never knows unless that risk is taken ,

title: "Follow the blue arrows..."
review: and as Amelie shows , the risk is often worth the effort .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: May 31 , 2011 . It has been ten years since " Le Fabuleux Destin d"Amélie Poulain " was first screened in France .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: Being such imaginative work of writer - director Jean - Pierre Jeunet ( Delicatessen , The City of Lost Children ) , Amélie has become one of the most iconic films of contemporary French cinema , an obligatory reference to the magical atmosphere of Paris .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: The film is presented with a beautiful and dynamic visual approach ( great camera work by Bruno Delbonnel and meticulous editing ) , reaffirming Audrey Tatou"s character"s French identity with an amusing score for piano and accordion by Yann Tiersen .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: Following an optimistic and innocent - spirited script , the film follows life of Amélie , a girl who finds satisfaction in helping others without realizing that it is she who needs it the most .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: While the film could be described as a French romantic comedy , it is also a gorgeous depiction of Paris , its people , music , cafés , metro stations , parks , etc , a representation that gets it right by not showing the overused and worn - out emblematic views of the city .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: At first glance , the plot is simple yet pleasantly naive , woven like a fantasy tale guided by an omniscient narrator .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: It does retain a logical order and proves complex .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: Though it is sometimes predictable , it is much entertaining .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: The characters , as in other films by Jeunet , are mostly eccentric and evolve throughout the film , often through small but curious and optimistic mundane stories , developed in parallel to that of Amelie .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: Bruno Delbonnel"s camera flies freely through scenarios , shooting well structured scenes that recall beautifully drawn pictures or artistic photographs with balanced composition and color .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: This unique visual work has characterized the work of Delbonnel with Jeunet , probably only bested by " A Very Long Engagement " .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: The colors were digitally enhanced for an added charm to the already attractive world if Amélie , intentionally highlighting green and red hues that characterize the films palette .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: Blue items are often found on each environment , symbolically representing protagonist"s mood .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: Acting may seem somewhat exaggerated if no background is provided .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: However , they bring life to the eclectic collection of exotic characters who populate the world of Amélie (

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: and for that matter , that of Jeunet ) , specially Dominique Pinon , who has collaborated on a recurring basis with the director .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: Audrey Tatou manages to build a believable character : a naturally naive , tender and warm - hearted girl who cares about others but is utterly alone .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: The soundtrack by musician and composer Yann Tiersen is one of the film"s greatest features .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: It reaffirms its French roots with melodic tunes , partly cheerful or nostalgic which have by now become classic movies themes ( Valse d"Amelie , Le Moulin ) , composed for accordion , piano , violin and xylophone , along with other instruments .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: The musical selection includes songs from previous albums by Tiersen as well as some specifically composed for the film .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: The film was well received by most critics ( mostly European ) who called it " positive and inspiring " , " visually beautiful "

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: but received little attention by the audience during commercial distribution outside of France , which may be explained by issues with distribution and publicity .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: Nonetheless , it received a total of 102 nominations from several competitions worldwide , winning 51 prizes .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: The film reached a broader audience after its VHS and DVD release , earning a well - deserved cult movie status after a few years .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: May 2011"s Blu - ray release commemorates its tenth anniversary ( the American version seems like the best to me , having DTSMasterAudio and 1080 ) .

title: 10 years of Amélie
review: Additionally , the film will be screened once more a some theaters in France for those fortunate enough who can see this beautiful film the way it should be seen .

title: Shy people getting the last laugh...
review: Unsocial young French woman , a waitress at a local café , has her life changed by fate one evening when she discovers a box of mementos in her apartment left behind by a long - ago former tenant ; reuniting the man and his belongings sets our heroine in motion to do more good deeds -- as well as play some amusing pranks .

title: Shy people getting the last laugh...
review: Whimsical , eccentric comedy with a romantic current , directed in a lickety - split manner by Jean - Pierre Jeunet , who also co - wrote the screenplay with Guillaume Laurant .

title: Shy people getting the last laugh...
review: The film"s wizened cognizance of daily human behavior may strike some as precious ( or perhaps as a stunt ) ,

title: Shy people getting the last laugh...
review: yet Jeunet"s attentive eyes and ears provide for some rapturous pay - offs .

title: Shy people getting the last laugh...
review: Enchanting and funny nearly throughout . * * * from * * * *

title: A fairy's touch
review: Jean - Pierre Jeunet is probably my favourite contemporary French filmmaker .

title: A fairy's touch
review: I love his unique visual style that borders on surrealism with the stylised colour palette , the warm yellows and greens and the dreamlike tint ,

title: A fairy's touch
review: and I love his highly imaginative , complex schemes , those " clockwork " or " domino effect " sequences which are so characteristic of his films .

title: A fairy's touch
review: I fell in love with his movies with The City of Lost Children

title: A fairy's touch
review: and while Amélie didn"t knock that one out of the top spot for me , it"s a great , funny , heart - warming movie with a very positive message that makes the world a happier place .

title: A fairy's touch
review: Cinematographer Bruno Delbonnel paints a fairytale - like picture of Paris which makes a perfect background for the story of the waitress - fairy , Amélie , played by Audrey Tautou ( she"s just adorable here ) , who wants to bring happiness into other people"s lives .

title: A fairy's touch
review: This is typical Jeunet ,

title: A fairy's touch
review: but the way he starts the film , the way Amélie summarises her past and the life around her through juxtaposing various statistical data , is reminiscent of another director"s work with a very distinct ( and painterly ) style : Peter Greenaway"s .

title: A fairy's touch
review: Being sort of fascinated with statistics myself , I found that a welcome addition .

title: A fairy's touch
review: Another clear influence that should be mentioned is Wong Kar - Wai"s Chungking Express ( another favourite of mine ) which has a lot in common with Amélie story - wise .

title: A fairy's touch
review: For me , Jeunet hit the mark four times in a row ( with The City of Lost Children , Alien : Resurrection , Amélie and A Very Long Engagement ) ,

title: A fairy's touch
review: and while I don"t consider Amélie his best , it is clearly his funniest , warmest and most easily digestible work .

title: A fairy's touch
review: A real feel - good movie .

title: Wordly cynicism be damned
review: While the fact that this is mainly an emotional film ( as all good films are ) necessitates a certain degree of hyperbole , I disagree that it is all that unrealistic and charge that Amelie"s detractors are those who are unrealistic .

title: Wordly cynicism be damned

title: Wordly cynicism be damned
review: Amelie is a person unable to separate how she feels about the world from how she interacts with it .

title: Wordly cynicism be damned
review: This translates into behavior which is often brave , sometimes crazy , and always lovable .

title: Wordly cynicism be damned
review: In this sense , then , Amelie is not a superhuman or a saint ( for she is also painfully aware of her shortcomings and petty vanities ) ,

title: Wordly cynicism be damned
review: but a person who has the courage to actually be herself and let her emotions , no matter how fanciful or " unrealistic " they may be , shape her world and the world of the others around her .

title: Wordly cynicism be damned
review: Simply put , every single person could be Amelie if he or she wanted to , except for our cynical and bitter insistence that people like Amelie don"t exist .

title: Wordly cynicism be damned
review: The main conflict , of course , comes when Amelie falters

title: Wordly cynicism be damned
review: and can not allow herself to follow through in this fashion in pursuing her own true love .

title: Wordly cynicism be damned
review: Truly , if ever the dangers of worldly cynicism ( or " realism " as we are fond of calling it these days ) have been shown more accurately in a film , I would love to see that film .

title: Wordly cynicism be damned
review: So , if the above description appeals to you , you will love the film .

title: Simply the best...
review: " Le Fabuleux destin d"Amélie Poulain " is the most fabulous movie in the world ! Do you know a lot of movies which make you so happy as this one ? " Le Fabuleux destin d"Amélie Poulain " is not only a movie : it"s a jewel of happiness , it"s the glory of life , it"s an amazing present for everybody , it"s almost a necessity for the merriness and the peace of the world ! ... Actually I don"t really have words to describe this extraordinary movie ! Moreover Paris is even more beautiful thanks to this movie - although Paris didn"t need it to be amazing ! Bruno Delbonnel"s cinematography is very original : all the colors are in harmony each other

title: Simply the best...
review: and with the story and the characters ... Ah the characters ! How interesting and warm they are !

title: Simply the best...
review: And all of them are magnificently interpreted .

title: Simply the best...
review: What about Yann Tiersen"s poetic music ? It"s strange to see that it contributes to the joy of the movie

title: Simply the best...
review: but that it is more melancholy -and sometimes sad- when you listen to the soundtrack without the movie ! In conclusion , " Le Fabuleux destin d"Amélie Poulain " put oneiric movies back on the scene ... So much the better !

review: In this part the pace of the movie is much slower , the voice - over less prominent and some scenes even fall in repetition ( 2nd punishment of the grocer for example ) , which lead to the conclusion that the movie would have gained by more editing and deleting in this segment .

review: It"s a kind of neo - fairytale or modern storybook romance , heightened to such with its narration and its wonderful score by Yann Tiersen , simple and melodic , like a small band playing in a cafè on a sunny afternoon .

review: and they are each as important as the next , no matter how much or how little the movie dwells on them .

review: It warms your heart , becoming overwhelming without being overbearing .

review: This is the romance of life and it"s intricacies , even in it"s darkest moments .

title: Fabulous French Fairytale!
review: but check out his earlier works " Delicatessen " and " The City Of Lost Children " ) , here he is allowed full rein over his expressionistic ideas and visions , brought to live by a simplistic and charming story of a young girl with an imaginative and inventive mind growing up with little or no friends where all she has for company is her fantastical views on people and her unique look on life .

review: Divulging further tit - bits in an entertaining and statistical manner over her families likes , dislikes and idiosyncrasy ( not just about Amelie but every character the camera comes across , we get a little story on obsessive compulsive behaviours ranging from bubble wrap popping to bone cracking ) .

title: Fabulous French Fairytale!
review: As we follow Amelie on her fabulous journey ( the English literal translation is The Fabulous Life of Amelie Poulain ! ) one event which affects our heroine is the death of Lady Diana .

title: Fabulous French Fairytale!
review: With the news playing in the background Amelie drops a lid , that rolls towards a tile , which happens to be loose and it"s there she finds someones hidden childhood memories .

title: Fabulous French Fairytale!
review: That night she decides to track down it"s owner , return it to him and if they are grateful she"ll continue to do further good deeds .

title: Fabulous French Fairytale!
review: From there on the film goes off on an extraordinary and incredible adventure where she becomes a match maker , a tour guide , a deceased lover and a woman looking for love amongst others .

title: Fabulous French Fairytale!

title: Fabulous French Fairytale!

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: 2001 saw the release of the fantastic French film " Amelie " ,

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: and it instantly ( and deservedly ) became an international hit .

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: A fantastic modern fairytale , " Amelie " follows the life and adventures of young and whimsical Amelie Poulain who embarks upon a life as a waitress in Paris .

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: Audrey Tautou puts in a stunning performance as Amelie , capturing the magic of the old silent movie stars whilst creating a charisma all her own .

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: Her elegant portrayal lights up the screen not dissimilarly to the wonderful Audrey Hepburn .

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: The style of the movie , wonderfully realised by director Jean Pierre Jeunet , captures the whimsy and fancy of Amelie herself .

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: Pefectly placed shots , quick camera movements and a vivid colouring give this film it"s own unique look .

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: Although the way the movie portrays Paris as perfect - overlooking the gritty downsides all cities must face - received some criticism when it was first released , Jeunet"s Paris is pristine and beautiful , reflecting the story itself .

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: This style has even gone on to create wonderful ripple effects in brilliant new TV shows like " Pushing Daisies " ,

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: and is similar to Tim Burton"s more colourful stylistic flourishes ( think " Big Fish " ) .

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: The story itself captures the imagination from the first frame , a story of eccentricity , friendship , love and finding your feet in the world , Amelie will make you laugh out loud , giggle amusedly , cry your heart out and last with you long after the final shot .

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: The fact that it is in French will make many viewers switch off instantly ,

title: Amelie: a modern CLASSIC
review: but although it being French is a curse for those of us who can not speak it , it is also its biggest charm .

review: I was very cynical about watching this movie when I first saw it , because of the subtitling ,

title: Simply Charming!
review: Amelie is a highly imaginative and charming young lady who retains her child - like ingenuities and uses them to serve and discipline mankind .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Her world is full of vibrant colors , destined chances , risky safe zones , and seemingly altruistic values .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Due to a lack of parental love when she was a child ( which otherwise would have boosted her self - worth and joy ) , Amelie resorts to her imagination to escape from the harsh realities that surround her ( i. E. Her mother dying in a suicidal freak accident ; her airy father being completely oblivious to her needs ) .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Reality often disappoints whereas her imagination does not .

title: Simply Charming!
review: From taking pictures of cloudy teddy bears in the sky , to watching people"s reactions in a movie theater , Amelie"s imagination carries her into adulthood to find what she most desires : love .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Upon coincidentally discovering a memory box of the previous owner of her apartment , Amelie embarks on a destined journey to find the owner

title: Simply Charming!
review: and return it to him .

title: Simply Charming!
review: When she realizes the wonderful impact of finding and returning the box to its owner , a humble man by the name of Bretodeau , her heart excites

title: Simply Charming!
review: and takes confidence in her new found discoverythat is , sharing love with others enriches your self - worth

title: Simply Charming!
review: and restores your joy ( two things Amelie lacked from her childhood ) .

title: Simply Charming!
review: As this surge of love illuminates her body , she becomes aware of how simple and clear life is .

title: Simply Charming!
review: She"s now discovered her life"s missionto serve mankind ! Her philosophy , however , is not entirely altruistic .

title: Simply Charming!
review: She has great need of people reciprocating to her alms in secret , thereby always receiving an instant rewardwhether watching their reactions from afar ( i. E. Spying on Bretodeau"s discovery in the phone booth ) , or , simply listening to the accolades they have for her ( i. E. Bretodeau talking to the bartender in her presence about " paying the kindness forward " and visiting his grandson ) .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Every kindness she gives is , in part , a kindness to herself .

title: Simply Charming!
review: In this manner , she is simply learning the positive effects of karma

title: Simply Charming!
review: and acquiring the love she longed for as a child .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Although she feels the essence of love for every kind deed she gives , there is still something missing .

title: Simply Charming!
review: She has not yet felt the euphoric effects of being in love with a person .

title: Simply Charming!
review: The challenge to find and keep her lover will determine her ability to enter a rebirth .

title: Simply Charming!
review: She has always been satiated in doing alms in secret ,

title: Simply Charming!
review: but will eventually have to find a reborn confidence of facing those in whom she loves on a personal level .

title: Simply Charming!
review: When seemingly stumbling upon the man she has feelings for , Nino Quincampoix , a man who , like herself , finds pleasure in helping others , she loses her confidence to act face to face and begins to speak the only language of love she knows : secret gift - giving .

title: Simply Charming!
review: She slowly begins overcoming her fear of love by taking healthy risks in order to acquire her desire .

title: Simply Charming!
review: A specific metaphysical sequence that helps demonstrate how she overcomes this fear is when she rides the carnival ride from hell ; Nino"s work environment .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Hell is often associated with feelings of fear , anxiety , or any other emotional vices labeled as causing pain or discomfort .

title: Simply Charming!
review: The idea that Amelie is stepping out of her comfort zonea ride from hellknowing full well the risk she is taking of potentially being rejected , demonstrates her willingness to suspend her fear and embrace a resilient sense of moral courage .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Another moment that helps her gather the courage to overcome her fear of rejection is when the artist known as " the glass man " , sends her a video tape commanding her not to let him pass , lest her heart later in life becomes as brittle as his bones .

title: Simply Charming!
review: By the end of the film , she has taken enough chances

title: Simply Charming!
review: and learned from her mistakes of not allowing fear to dominate her choices ( i. E. Denying who she was to Nino at the restaurant ) .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Consequently , she is found nestled in the warmth of Nino"s arms . Filmmaker"s Purpose .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Jeunet"s purpose in making this film is to convey the following message : Every person wants to leave their mark upon the world and be remembered in the highest possible esteem .

title: Simply Charming!
review: For most this is achieved by bringing forth good and honorable works so that others might see those works

title: Simply Charming!
review: and emulate the same .

title: Simply Charming!
review: It is a message of understanding the positive repercussions of karma and how continuing to perpetuate good will unto mankind leads to ultimate happiness .

title: Simply Charming!
review: Certain aesthetical elements help support this theme .

title: Simply Charming!
review: The diegetic music played from a record player in the subway station during Amelie"s first encounter with the blind man sings as follows : " How could I live ; never to know the joy that you give ; when I"m in your arms ; I"m under your charms .

title: Simply Charming!
review: " The fact that the blind man is holding the record player is symbolic of a prayer he is giving to the world .

title: Simply Charming!
review: The lyrics help foreshadow the joys and charms that Amelie will yet present to the blind man prayer when later helping him cross the street , describing in immaculate detail the vibrant scenery he has never experienced .

title: Simply Charming!
review: A specific camera movement and supplementary special effect is also used during the blind man sequence in the street .

title: Simply Charming!
review: After helping him along the way and describing to him the delicate scene , Amelie leaves the man to ponder for himself what just took place .

title: Simply Charming!
review: The camera is on a crane and is looking down upon the man as he looks heavenward .

title: Simply Charming!
review: It"s as if he"s looking to God , expressing his thanks for the kindness just granted to him .

title: Simply Charming!
review: To make the moment even more surreal , a special effect is used to highlight the man"s surrounding in a brilliant fire - like glow .

title: Simply Charming!
review: He has certainly been touched by the love of mankind , or better stated , the love of God .

title: Simply Charming!
review: The viewer is left to assume that the man"s life was affected for the better , restoring his confidence in mankind

title: Simply Charming!
review: and perpetuating his own good will onto others .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: What can anybody say about this magical film which has not already been said ? I saw it again

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: and decided there are some things .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: This film has deep roots in a rich tradition of reality - as - imagination , as portrayed in French literature and poetry .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: It evokes the " impossibile realities " of Andre Breton"s romantic surrealist novel " Nadja " , together with its love of the mystery of certain Paris locations .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: As so much of the film takes place at the Gare de l"Est , which was the favourite haunt of the unique poet and writer of " glimpses " , Leon - Paul Fargue , the film draws much from his eccentric imaginative tradition too .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: And as anyone knows who has read the magnificent 27 volume novel " Men of Good Will " by Jules Romains , as I have , that tale recounts the communication between two young lovers by means of signs and messages posted in public places , just as we see in this film .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: Whether Jean - Pierre Jeunet , the director , is aware of these things consciously in the way that he must be of the many cinematic references he makes , I have no way of knowing .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: But these things are in the blood and the bone of every Parisian .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: And although he is a Loire man , Jeunet is a Parisian now .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: As for the raids which Audrey Tatou makes on Collignon"s flat in the film , these are a standard Surrealist activity .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: I knew well the " last of the British Surrealists " , David Gascoyne ( an intimate of Paul Eluard and friend of Breton ) , as well as his friend Kathleen Raine , a British poetess .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: Kathleen told me that one time when David was upset with her , he broke into her house in Chelsea

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: and " staged a Surrealist raid on her home " .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: He turned all of her furniture upside down

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: and left , - a clear precursor to Audrey Tatou ! You breathe these things in the air of Paris ,

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: and if you have read any 20th century French literature , these things leap out at you and grab you by your solar plexus until you turn into a Jean - Pierre Jeunet .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: This film is perfect , everyone in it is perfect , everything about it is perfect ,

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: and I won"t hear a word or whisper of criticism of it from anyone who doesn"t wish a Surrealist raid on his home made in retaliation .

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: Long live the Imagination Liberation Front ! Down with the forces of mediocrity and drabness ! May there be magic everywhere !

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: And thank you , " little elf with big eyes like a deer " ,

title: The Perfect Rendering of Imagination as Reality
review: and thank you , garden gnome who travels the world , and thank you Jeunet , you mischievous fellow and all who sailed in you !
