review: I"ve been admiring Jeunet since his beginnings .

title: The real creative types
review: A highly creative person , with an ( unfortunately ) very rare poetic , naïve , sincere approach to storytelling , giving this fresh and heartwarming result found in " Delicatessen " and " La Cité " .

title: The real creative types
review: Mixed with an obvious passion for highly technical , tricky , difficult filmmaking , not far from DePalma"s quasi - neurotic approach ,

title: The real creative types
review: and with a strong European fantasy cultural background , his works are as eccentric , highly personal , immediately recognizable as those from -say- Gilliam , Kubrick or Cronenberg ( and Jackson before he sold his soul to the moneymaking system ) .

title: The real creative types
review: Jeunet is really one of a kind ,

title: The real creative types
review: and when looking back in time , I can tell he"s been a major influence in filmmaking over the last decade , even if the general public is not aware of this .

title: The real creative types
review: Quite a lot of cinematic elements from his movies have been borrowed by the Wachowsky brothers , David Fincher , Alex Proyas and other -much lesser- directors .

title: The real creative types
review: Unfortunately or fortunately , only stylistic elements were borrowed .

title: The real creative types
review: No one touched the inner soul of his work .

title: The real creative types
review: The only attempt that I"m aware of is " Chocolat " that is , despite Depp"s usual greatness and a marvelous script , a laughable inconsistent mess .

title: The real creative types
review: In " Amelie " , it"s Jeunet"s turn to borrow from another filmmaker"s work .

title: The real creative types
review: Once again , very few people will actually ever notice this , as the source of " Amelie"s " cinematic structure is inspired from a very obscure , overlooked movie : Garspard Noé"s " Seul contre tous " , which is like " Amelie""s evil twin .

title: The real creative types
review: These two movies are quite different in tone ( that"s the least to say )

title: The real creative types
review: and tell very different stories ,

title: The real creative types
review: but they share something else than a quasi - identical editing structure : the will to awake something that"s asleep deep within our minds , a part of us we have chosen to forget since our adolescence , because the western societies wants us to be " adults " .

title: The real creative types
review: Jeunet has always been obsessed with this paradoxical notion of " childhood " and " maturity " .

title: The real creative types
review: He already tried to teach us a lesson in " La Cité .. " , during the confrontation between Miette and Krank : the older character is the immature one ,

title: The real creative types
review: and the younger one is the mature one .

title: The real creative types
review: The extraordinary ( and technically beautiful ) metaphor of Krank turning into an infant as Miette turns into an old woman is the climax of Jeunet"s essay .

title: The real creative types
review: The message is clear : we , " adults " , are missing an important part of our personality by putting our inner child in standby mode ,

title: The real creative types
review: and more than this , we are actually less mature because of this .

title: The real creative types
review: I tend to agree with Jeunet ,

title: The real creative types
review: and the fact that so many people were genuinely , deeply moved by " Amelie " , much more than by the ordinary " sentimental " mush the movie industry feeds us , seems to prove that indeed , something in us is waiting to be awaken .

title: The real creative types
review: Something that Noé , with " Seul contre tous " , tries to awake too ,

title: The real creative types
review: but with a very different , much more intellectual -though heavily brutal- method .

title: The real creative types
review: " Amelie""s success is a slap in the face of all those who claim they know what the public wants ,

title: The real creative types
review: and produce soapy , unpersonal , vapid , glossy but empty stereotyped stuff .

title: The real creative types
review: See : give them some real poetry , they actually LOVE it .

title: The real creative types
review: So much for the cynical idea that the public only eats s***t .

title: The real creative types
review: Jean - Pierre Jeunet and Gaspard Noé ( who"s responsible for the mind - blowing , utterly upsetting , thought - provoking and highly controversial " Irréversible " ) are the real creative types of today"s European cinema now that Almodovar totally lost control

title: The real creative types
review: and Bertrand Blier gets so multi - layered that his movies should come with a 2 inches - thick user"s manual ( yet his " Un , deux , trois soleil " stays IMO one of the best European movies ever ) .

title: The real creative types
review: Oh and Kubrick is not around anymore ( sob ) .

title: The real creative types
review: Jeunet feeds us with rejuvenating magical poetry , Noé feeds us with upsetting but essential ethic questionings .

title: The real creative types
review: Both work with a high level of abstraction , an uncompromising attitude , and a very impressive cinematic vocabulary .

title: The real creative types
review: They totally compliment each other .

title: The real creative types
review: Let"s hope they"ll keep on making more and more and more great stuff .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Well , " Amelie " at least allows me to forget " Alien Resurrection " .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: I"m a huge Jeunet fan , or to be more precise , a Jeunet / Caro fan .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: City of Lost Children and Delicatessen are two of my favorite films from the last ten years in which they were probably the most visually inventive and influential directors around .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Films like " The Matrix " stole gratuitously from their visual aesthetic .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Those films were nutty sci - fi / comedy / adventures where Amelie rests in more commonplace ground ( albeit ` Magic Realist " ) .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: It bears an almost too - close resemblance to the genre represented by " You"ve Got Mail " , except Jenuet"s filmmaking is far more vibrant

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: and the laughs more genuine than in such spit - polished mainstream fare .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: There was also an honest and buried melancholy in Amelie which I stayed with .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Of course there were plenty of bits that plastered a dumb smile on your face .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: In " Delicatessan " and " City of Lost Children " there was in several sections of helter - skelter action , almost impossible to follow in the first viewing .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: In ` City " , there was one brilliant comic / cosmic moment where the girl"s teardrop set off a chain of ludicrously logical actions that resulted in saving her life .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Another scene in it had one where a group of child thieves retrieved a key in a door with a ridiculously complicated scheme .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Much of " Amelie " is an extension in spirit of those two sequences from " City " ; mad chains of association like Chuck Jones and Friz Freleng used to essay in .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Jeunet had been toying with such connections - of - fate right through those first two films ,

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: and here he took them to hyperbolic lengths ( still preferable to the excruciatingly self - conscious " Run Lola Run " ) .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: In the insane breadth of modern life , Jeunet senses , there are grand chains of causality .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Mathieu Kassovitz"s Nino is a passive observer of one such chain , searching for his favored traces ( the torn - up photos ) in his attempts to make out something of its shape .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: He collects and studies these totems that tease him with practically unsolvable questions , like the identity of the mystery man , and gets an emotional kick out of this monument to chance and isolation .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Amelie , on the other hand , seeks to be a whole chain in herself ; invisibly she tried to alter lives and manipulate events .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: She wants to be a glorious mystery .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: The price she willingly pays for this is self - erasure .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Where Nino , dumped into reality by childhood brutality , has reduced himself to an observant speck in the urban cosmos , Amelie , the lonely sprite , having brought herself up in a fantasy universe , naturally expresses herself through interventions that make her something resembling a meddling Greek goddess or Fury .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: The drama of the piece then is in seeing Amelie try to re - integrate herself with reality ( in love with Nino ) without too much pain .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Only Amelie can fulfill Nino"s quest because she plays with omnipotence .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: But it costs her much , too , as much as it fulfills her ; she sees her plans occasionally wobble , fail , and become tragic ( like the romance she sets up only to see it slide into destructive , repetitive behavior ) .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: It"s an almost theological question - is this what God goes through six billion times a day ?

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: But it"s clear what Jeunet"s thesis is ; his filmmaking is equivalent to Amelie"s dreaming and subsequent actions , they"re both weavers of intoxicating magic .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: That"s really all the drama there was

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: and it was a might thin for the film"s length ( about twenty minutes too long ) ,

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: but there were very solid , affecting emotional strands in the work ; often it was like a meditation of forms of alienation and sorrow , lump - in - the - throat worthy ,

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: and it surprises me when people comment that it"s all so lightweight .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: I was glad Jeunet didn"t try to wrap everything up neat .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: The scene where the couple have love - starved sex in the toilet causing the café to shudder was nearly up there with the bedspring scene from " Delicatessan " ( to which there was a neat reference also in the film ) .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Indeed , was a genuinely laugh - out - loud comedy , the first I"ve seen in - I don"t know how long .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: However , some of its comic bits , funny as they were ( like the gnome in the international photos ) , seemed , well , second - hand .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Much of the film was an almost mechanical process of watching Amelie set up her plans .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: There was a dizzying flow of information offset by what was actually a very simple little yarn of lovelorn not - quite - losers in the big city .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Like Amelie herself , it was ostentatiously modest .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Despite the superficial modernity , the film like " City " and " Delicatessen " was set in some weird netherworld between now and 1950 ( a more innocent act really than all those French Socialist newspapers claimed ) with a shimmering vision of a surviving cozy Paris full of cozy Gallic types , looking for the good heart even in the grindingly staid bourgeoisie ( like Amelie"s parents ) that are usually the complete anathema to French artists .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: I agree with the general proposition that this film was about twenty minutes too long .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: I felt the weight mostly in the middle ; I was thinking " Come along Mr Jeunet , tighten the pace a touch .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: " All those speed - cinema tricks do not actually make for a fast film .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Jeunet"s films always have a love of eccentric humanity

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: but gosh darn it I miss those apocalyptic landscapes and the harder edge Marc Caro used to give .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Plenty of Edible French Chic here

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: but not so much nouveau cuisine as a fine chocolate liqueur .

title: Magic Realism meets Chuck Jones
review: Not , thankfully , a complete souflee .

title: All Hollywood should hide in front of Amélie
review: I"d been trying for a long time to get out of the cinema happier than I got in : I was persuaded it was quite impossible , until I saw this wonderful great movie ! Amélie is the paladin of the weak , the outcast , the people considered different and therefore outcast , she represents the victory of David against Goliath , of the good against the evil , of the weak against the strong , etc .

title: All Hollywood should hide in front of Amélie
review: In Amélie love and good are brought at the purest , heart - reawakening level , to show how simple is helping others to be happy .

title: All Hollywood should hide in front of Amélie
review: Amélie is the friend who everybody of us dreams to have : a sweet , tender , always available , innocent , pure - hearted girl with who you can share your fears , joy and sorrow and from who you can learn how to enjoy small pleasures of life .

title: All Hollywood should hide in front of Amélie
review: Thanks to the magic setting in a cleaned - up and romantic Paris , to the inscrutable simplicity of the characters , but mainly to the skillful interpretation of this wonderful new star Audrey Tautou finally we have a new reference point in the universe of the good cinema .

title: All Hollywood should hide in front of Amélie
review: Nothing in common with Hollywood"s millionaire , overrated crap ! I"m sad Amélie has been so underevaluated at the Césars and at the Academy Awards ,

title: All Hollywood should hide in front of Amélie
review: but the biggest success comes from the public , this is the most important success of this great movie .

title: All Hollywood should hide in front of Amélie
review: There can"t be another evaluation for me than 10 out of 10 , I recommend it strongly : as for me I"m going to watch it tomorrow ( March 27th ) again .

title: Romance is alive...
review: ... But this film could easily be regarded as the category killer of the romantic comedy genre .

title: Romance is alive...
review: There are very few ways that anyone could make a better " boy meets girl " film than " Amelie " .

title: Romance is alive...
review: It makes the endless succession of Hollywood romantic comedies look dull and ordinary by comparison .

title: Romance is alive...
review: But what a curious pedigree ! The director , Jean - Pierre Jeunet , gave us bizarre nightmares and post - apocalyptic alienation in " Delicatessen " and " City of Lost Children " , although it must be said that both of those films include beautiful romantic moments .

title: Romance is alive...
review: " Amelie " retains some of the surreal elements of the two earlier films ,

title: Romance is alive...
review: but there is a lightness of spirit about Amelie that sets it apart and makes it something truly special .

title: Romance is alive...
review: Audrey Tautou gives a magnificent performance as the quirky , clever , but intensely shy Amelie .

title: Romance is alive...
review: We believe that we truly understand her as she secretly makes changes in the lives of those around her , playing matchmaker for some , bringing unlooked - for happiness , punishing the wicked with impish glee ,

title: Romance is alive...
review: but when it comes to her own pleasure and happiness , we see her torment and feel her pain as she is unable to make that crucial final step .

title: Romance is alive...
review: How the Academy failed to recognise the quality of this performance with a Best Actress nomination is frankly incomprehensible .

title: Romance is alive...
review: I note BAFTA among others got it right .

title: Romance is alive...
review: There is much more to like about this film .

title: Romance is alive...
review: The ensemble supporting cast , music , cinematography , the curious use of colour ( Jeunet films are alike in this respect , the look like no - one else"s ) , the narration - just enough of it without being intrusive .

title: Romance is alive...
review: I have very few criticisms .

title: Romance is alive...
review: The subtitling can be a challenge to read at times

title: Romance is alive...
review: and I thought at least one translation could have been better .

title: Romance is alive...
review: This is hardly a fault with the original film , however , just the barrier of language .

title: Romance is alive...
review: Finally , a small reprimand to Jeunet for reprising the classic bonking scene from " Delicatessen " .

title: Romance is alive...
review: It just wasn"t as funny the second time around .

title: Romance is alive...
review: Otherwise , great film , see it .

title: Romance is alive...
review: If you don"t like it , you have no soul .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: About a year ago , I saw a movie that quite literally changed my life and went on to become one of my favorite movies . Ever .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: Le Fabuleux destin d"Amélie Poulain , or Amelie for short .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: It"s this 2 - hour - long , little French movie directed by Jean - Pierre Jeunet in 2001 that has become one of the world"s most endearing movies in history .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: There"s a certain charming , whimsical quality about it that just makes me want to cry , laugh , and sigh at the same time .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: The most intriguing thing about it is that it is made entirely in French .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: The fact that this wholly French movie gained such prestige in an English - speaking country illustrates just how powerful it is .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: The movie has a very simple plot , entailing the journeys an innocent girl named Amelie Poulain has when one day she decides to help those around her .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: Amelie takes pleasure in the little things in life : cracking open creme brulee with a teaspoon , dipping her hands into an open sack of beans , or looking at people"s expressions in the dark during a movie .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: She likes her solitude ; she doesn"t talk to many people and her only friend is a painter named Dufayel who paints the same Renoir painting day after day .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: One day , she decides to enrich people"s lives by doing little , mischievous things .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: She helps a blind person cross the street

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: and describes very vividly and beautifully the various sights on the streets , letting the blind person " see " for a couple of moments .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: She helps two people find love at the café where she works as a waitress .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: She plays a trick with a garden gnome so that she can convince her father to fulfill his lifelong wish : to travel the world .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: Amelie is so busy trying to assist other people that she overlooks her own life .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: When she falls in love with a man just as eccentric as she is who collects old Photomaton pictures , she seems to unable to overcome her own shyness to approach .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: She can not take charge of her own life

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: and can only dream romantically of the life she could have with him .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: Amelie needs to confront this man in order to make these dreams reality .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: It"s a very quirky movie ,

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: but the little quirks are what make it so enchanting and childlike .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: I am in love with everything about this movie .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: The cinematography is pure genius , capturing camera angles to achieve the most dizzying and fantastic effects .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: One of my favorite shots is at the beginning of the movie where Amelie is skipping stones at a canal and all of a sudden it switches from a high - angle shot of the bridge to a low - angle shot of the trickling water below .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: Visually , the effect is stunning .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: And the soundtrack .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: Oh wow , it"s indescribable .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: I can sit at my desk and pop my headphones on and be instantly transported back into Amelie"s dream world , in shades of reds and greens where tiny miracles happen .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: This movie has really changed my outlook on life .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: I think everybody has a little Amelie in them , marveling at life"s ironies

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: and truly appreciating the small things life has to offer .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: Each action is something wondrous , from the wind moving the wine glasses the crunch of newly fallen snow beneath your feet .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: You just have to learn to reach for that moment where you really feel alive and free .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: Every time I see the movie ( which is really more than I ought to , I can practically memorize the dialog now ) , I walk away a little wiser , a little happier , and a little less cynical .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: We all have had our hopes and dreams shattered , we have all had to endure the little heartbreaks that simply go with life ,

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: but Amelie showed me to celebrate the small moments that I do have .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: For life is ephemeral , a collage of a million little things to cherish ,

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: and it is too short to walk around in with your eyes tightly shut .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: Amelie isn"t one of those " everything"s breezy " films where nothing ever goes wrong ; it"s has its sad , poignant moments , just as life does .

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: Life has its ups and downs ,

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: but the movie taught me to take what life hands me

title: discovering life's little miracles
review: and revel in the little marvels it has to offer .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: AMELIE ( 2001 ) * * * * Audrey Tautou , Mathieu Kassovitz , Rufus , Yolande Moreau , Artus de Penguern , Urbain Cancelier , Maurice Benichou , Dominique Pinon , Claude Perron , Michel Robin , Isabelle Nanty , Clotilde Mollet , Claire Maurier , Serge Merlin , Jamel Debbouze .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: ( Dir : Jean - Pierre Jeunet ) FRENCH W / SUBTITLES Ever since Audrey Hepburn has passed critics and film pundits alike have been trying with great effort ( and no reward ) to bestow her gamine crown to another actress along the likes of Irene Jacob , Anne Parillaud , Juliette Binoche , Julia Ormond , Rachael Leigh Cook and even Julia Roberts as possible heirs to the throne of romantic comedy .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: Well stop the presses .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: We have a winner in the amiable , flawlessly pretty French over - night - sensation that is Audrey Tautou , an utterly fetching and undeniably sexy comic actress with Ms. Hepburn"s innocence tainted by curious frivolity .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: That"s just what is on display in full force to be reckoned with in this frothy fairy tale As the titular innocent Amelie is a precocious yet well - meaning romantic at heart who makes it her life"s work to intrude on others " lives ; that is by making changes for the good and positive to friends , strangers ( and even enemies ) alike .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: Her whole life has been about enjoying the simple things and their unique calming qualities that she wishes were encompassed by all around her .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: She helps a blind man cross the street vividly describing all imagery that they pass ; she gets even with the browbeating produce market manager by infiltrating his apartment and making subtle adjustments to his daily life like changing the sizes of his bedroom slippers and adding sugar to his liquor cabinet"s stock ; she finds herself fixing up the local stalker with the addled hypochondriacal cashier in the diner she works as a waitress .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: Ultimately Amelie"s destiny is to make life more pleasant

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: and in the process for the first time in her lively existence despite her loneliness , falls in love .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: The object of her affection is an odd fellow who she spies in the metro sweeping up torn pieces of photos from one of those sit for a quarter 4 poses machines for travelers to take snapshots of themselves .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: Nino ( Kassovitz ) is a quiet man who uses the scraps to fill a huge album of memories of complete strangers in a weird art - as - life metaphor for how we all should perceive life in general : passing by in a sea of faceless strangers ( that is giving credence to those we don"t know as being significant ) .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: The latter is well on display here as Amelie lives her carefree lifestyle by doling out personal chores of goodwill and its charm is that she is self - less and even self - deprecating .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: The fact that she is cute as a button doesn"t hurt her either as she befriends many unlikely companions including an elderly brittle man in her apartment complex who invites her in to see his life - long preoccupation of re - creating paintings from memories of exhibits he saw in his past .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: The humor is also on full throttle in the sarcastic interplay with many of the denizens of the picaresque Montmatre and Paris particularly with the diner inhabitants and one hysterical running gag with Amelie"s practical joke on her reserved father involving her abduction of his garden gnome by giving it an international jaunt and her father receiving snapshots by mail of the statue in famed cities having a ball .

title: VIVE LE FRANCE!
review: Utterly charming and exquisitely photographed by Bruno Delbonnel in saturated unreal living color has the appeal of a surreal picture postcard brought to life , the film relies on the slender yet capable shoulders of its ingenue , another Audrey who I hope will be around as the original .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: Amélie is a film predicated off of a whimsical color pattern - consisting mostly of urine - yellows , pea - greens , and blood - reds - and an impossibly fantastical world with a unique presence at its core .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: It opens by defining the characters that surround our protagonist Amélie Poulain ( the uniquely beautiful Audrey Tautou ) by their strangest , most peculiar quirks ; one character gets deep enjoyment out of using his fingers to elaborately dissect the hot carcus of a turkey and another character"s greatest pleasure is emptying our her purse just to put everything back again .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: In the grand scheme , these quirks are fairly minor ,

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: but the fact that these are the traits screenwriter Guillaume Laurant wants us to immediately associate these characters with - not a job , a specific education , a personality trait , or a personal history - is , in itself , a tad subversive .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: With that , we finally meet Amélie , a woman who was kept largely sheltered as a child , being homeschooled by her now - dead mother

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: and , as a result , learning to escape monotony and certain gloom by running away in the realms of her imagination .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: Working as a waittress at the Café des 2 Moulins in Montmartre , France , Amélie has consistently led a fairly isolated life largely focused on herself , until one day , her motivations change in the blink of an eye .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: Upon hearing the breaking news report concerning the death of Princess Diana , she drops the cap to her perfume , which rolls and eventually dislodges a loose tile .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: Behind the tile is a small tin of trinkets , presumably belonging to a young child .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: Amélie decides it was something of her destiny to find this box

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: and return it to the rightful owner ,

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: and before long , she finds her destiny of helping others panning out with another circumstance of a lost item .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: The significance and contents of said lost items are irrelevant ; their purpose is to , in turn , provide Amélie with something she never had before and that something is a reason to exist and belong .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: Throughout her life , while not depressed nor particularly sad , Amélie"s loneliness has been a constant thing she"s had to battle in her day - to - day actions ; it"s been the typical daily occurrence of her to wake up , go to work , and relish in her alone time for years on end .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: These situations allow her to search for some kind of companionship , further develop her love for humankind , and find maybe even find a romantic partner .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: Of course , I"m making this sound a lot more extravagant than I think I should be .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: Amélie , through all its color and decorated mise - en- scene , is a drearily familiar story with its original element being the fact that it"s captured in a realm of artificiality that , in turn , makes it appear far more compelling than it ever manages to naturally be .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: It reminds me of the lesser films of Wes Anderson , which weren"t so much concerned about how many objects , costumes ,

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: and people could be fixed into one particular frame , or the general excitement of dialog as much as they were presentation and eccentric dialog .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: While the visuals in Amélie are colorful marbles ,

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: and the juxtaposition of characters with cinematographical color ( the work of the great Bruno Delbonnel , who"d go on to work with the Coen brothers and Tim Burton in more recent years ) is unmistakable , these efforts feel more geared to disguise the fact that Amélie is a relatively simple story with little in the way of remarkable themes .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: The presence of scenes ostensibly colored by way of a filter over the lens , canted angles ( most notably during a scene showcasing a character named Bredoteau"s most traumatic moment as a child ) , and lavish setpieces almost entirely blind us by whimsy and warmth until we realize the takeaway from the film is that of an empty candy wrapper .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: There"s something to be said about Tautou , however , who remains an interesting screen presence throughout the film simply because of her presentation .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: Her jet - black hair , petite figure , frequently blood- red wardrobe and lipstick , and ghostly paleness make her protrude out in nearly every scene , even if the background is a pulsating hue of red - as it is in a scene when she reads a letter in a bathroom .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: In addition , scenes in the sex shop bring a fascinating level of warmth to a place often condemned and avoided for its almost inherent seaminess .

title: A beautiful, but empty, candy wrapper
review: But just like I find myself doing now , one winds up remembering Amélie for short , eye - catching scenes rather than a complete film with an impacting takeaway .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: Amelie , and girls like her , if even her most distorted versions , are the loves of my life .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: With that , yes , I am implying my strong support for polygamy — there"s nothing unethical about it .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: Amelie follows simple rules — good to good , bad to bad — and with that mindset , she can classify everything relatively .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: She doesn"t need help , with exceptions of destiny and miracle ,

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: and some pragmatic skills — mechanics , job , planning , logistics , money , and a lot of imagination .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: She"s one of those who love to work , but not in the mainstream category ; they work for selfless motives , with little pinches of comic and awkwardness .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: Several things pop - up Amelie"s mind in the manner of bubble - wraps ; she can"t control her urges .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: She loves to play with real people with real ideas , only to marginalize their fake disguises , that is , to bring out their true - selves .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: Occasionally , she is betrayed by her humanitarian instincts which humiliate her for plunging into things that do not directly concern her ,

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: but that"s a necessary stake .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: With colorful reasoning and pondering , most of which are deceitful and wild , she tends to look - up the hidden good behind everything around .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: However , like with all humans , she is selfish — she wants to be loved back , not appreciated ; she wants people to be happy ,

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: and thus , to make herself happy .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: That"s the only degree of selfishness to which she can go .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: Spending hours on freak - show - albums , returning nostalgic accessories to " 50s people who once lived in her apartment , counting the number of orgasms in neighborhood , spying on the painter - next - door , turning people into victims of war , heist , and revolt , and sending off dad"s gnome on a world tour are few of the things she does ,

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: and as weird as they may sound , they are for their own benefit , if mildly so .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: Audrey Tautou has pulled this one off brilliantly .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: I"ve seen only one of her works before — The Da Vinci Code in which she plays a leading role in the adaptation of Dan Brown"s historical thriller ; she was good

review: but didn"t really have a " role " .

review: Now that I have seen Amelie , I"m surely going to hit her more .

review: and believe me , I mean this as a complement .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: It"s harder to express yourself just through eyes than with the whole posture .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: You should try doing this at home — playing an introverted maniac for a day just through weird expressions ; I"m sure you"ll look like a dumb monkey and nothing else .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That

review: I mean she didn"t deserve a win ,

review: but surely a nomination .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: Anyways , I won"t criticize the Academy again ; they"ve done some real favors for me lately .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: Even when you put Amelie aside from the movie , the way the story is narrated is charmingly unique .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: The bizarre shots , cinematography , set - design ( practically everything ) , sensory details , direct interaction with the audience ( when Amelie stares at the screen with that creepy smile ) , and weird footage ( babies swimming , one - legged country man tap - dancing ) make it so exhilarating an experience that it can never leave audiences " minds ( well , it won"t mine ) .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: I won"t call it excellent directing , because the scribbled facts were simply told in the most understandable way .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: I would therefore laud the writer , because the imagery of set , angles , minute details ( yes , like the one where Amelie notices an insect on the screen behind the couple in a movie ) and order are almost entirely on writer"s shoulders ; this has surely been one of the finest pieces of written art I"ve ever seen .

review: The world of Amelie is unique .

title: If Only Everyone Was Like That
review: She creates modified models of it , while accepting the world as it is ,

review: and this is a great gift .

review: My intuition tells me that men / women like Amelie do exist ,

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water
review: For those who are familiar with some of Jeunet"s other films , in particular City of Lost Children and Delicatessan , Amelie is a little more down to Earth , though that is a little bit of an overstatement because the larger than life characters are still present along with some of the more bizarre occurrences that you would expect from such a film .

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water
review: The only reason I say that it is more down to Earth is simply because it is set in modern Paris ,

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water
review: and the events are a little more realistic and believable ( with the exception of Amelie"s mother dying when somebody decides to jump off of the Notre Dame and just happens to land on top of her ) .

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water
review: Amelie is basically a love story , though it is not what one would expect from your standard Hollywood offering .

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water
review: It is much better , particularly because the characters , including the main character , are so larger than life .

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water
review: Amelie"s father is a doctor , and not a very good one at that , namely because he mistakes Amelie"s quick beating heart due to anxiety as a heart condition

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water
review: and thus prevents her from going to school for fear that she may die .

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water
review: However Amelie , despite growing out isolated from society with an overtly protective mother and father , does manage to go out into the world , however one gets the impression that she is an observer , not necessarily interacting on the world"s level .

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water

review: and decides to go and find the owner , however she does so in a way that nobody actually knows that it is her doing this .

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water
review: After getting such a thrill she decides that her purpose in life is to go a make people"s lives just that little bit better ,

title: Blows your Hollywood Rom-Com out of the water
review: but in a way that nobody actually knows that she is the one doing it .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: If ever there was a film that closely resembled an actual work of art , Amelie has to be one of them .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: Between the presentation , the charming story and the unbelievably engaging Audrey Tautou as Amelie , it is not difficult to see why this film has quickly become a beloved modern classic .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: * Possible spoilers within * There are no ` slow spots " in Amelie you are immediately thrown into the story , which is anonymously narrated in a rapid - fire opening sequence , where if you blink you"ll miss something .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: From the narrator we learn that Amelie was an only child of neurotic parents who were unaffectionate ,

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: but smothering enough to mold her into an introspective and quirky loner who , as an adult is now living a quiet life as a waitress .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: She is still introspective and quirky ,

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: and through a serendipitous occurrence , decides to anonymously help others .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: This may mean playing matchmaker to the lonely , returning long - lost property or keeping company with other lonely eccentrics ,

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: but the result is generally positive and the experiences personally rewarding for Amelie who relishes in her anonymous status .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: It is when she finds love in one of her ` projects " that conflict arises for her .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: It is impossible not to fall in love with Amelie , who is so charming that even when she is dispensing her own brand of justice against a hateful man by doing little irritating things to his flat like exchange his toothpaste for foot cream or resetting his alarm clock for a couple of hours earlier than normal , she is completely adorable , perhaps more so because the ` evil deeds " are so inherently innocent in the grand scheme of things .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: Her imagination and innocence is both endearing and admirable ,

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: and Audrey Tautou is so engaging and beautiful that she provides the perfect vessel

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: and face for this heroine .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: Additionally , the excellent supporting cast is a perfect compliment to its leading lady .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: The film itself is absolutely marvelous and awe - inspiring .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: The cinematography employs a lot of rapid - fire movements ,

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: and the camera work is incredibly original .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: The set design has the colors and energy of a Fauvist painting by Henri Matisse and the charm and quaint feel of a post - Impressionist Renoir , who himself is featured prominently in the film .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: Along with the script , which is both heart - warming and sentimental without losing its intelligence , Amelie is a modern day fairy tale that is so exuberant that it made me want to watch it again ,

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life
review: but was so profound and heart - felt that I was speechless and unable to weigh in with my opinion until I could let the film absorb into my brain like a sponge .

title: Like a Fauvist painting come to life

title: Feel good!
review: " Amelie " is an utterly charming French rom - com , that stands out due to director Jeunet"s quirky sense of humour , wonderful visual imagination , and above all his ability ( well evidenced in " Delicatessan " ) to create an atmosphere within which the whole film breathes .

title: Star rating: 3 out of 5
review: Throughout the movie ( known as Le Fabuleux destin d"Amelie Poulain in its country of origin , France ) the characters are presented as delightfully quirky - Amelie enjoys running her hands through sackfuls of grain ; her father likes lining up his shoes and polishing them ; Nino keeps an album of photos discarded by their owners - so the ending , where Amelie and Nino leap into bed together , just as would happen in any other movie , is a huge letdown .

title: Star rating: 3 out of 5

title: Charming Tribute to Odd Introverts
review: This film is inspiring on so many levels , not the least of which is how it manages to draw you in to the emotions of the protagonist by showing nothing more than a child amusing herself with home - made toys of a lost era in the first minutes of montage .

title: Charming Tribute to Odd Introverts
review: Amelie"s emotionally deprived and bizarre childhood seem at first to be preparing her to become a modern urban casuality a la the glass - man who paints copies of the same painting year after year , the bitter produce seller , the weeping tippler widow or the hypochondriac tobacco seller .

title: Charming Tribute to Odd Introverts
review: But her charm , beauty , piercing insight and natural openness work in her favor as she battles her own tendency to withdraw .

title: Charming Tribute to Odd Introverts
review: Finding a box of lost trinkets , she sets out to restore them to the rightful owner .

title: Charming Tribute to Odd Introverts
review: That good deed and the emotional transformation she witnesses seem to set her on a path to right wrongs having to do with personal loss and alienation that she sees in her fellow parisians , not the least of which is her widower father whose only emotional tie is with a garden gnome .

title: Charming Tribute to Odd Introverts
review: When love beckons Amelie , she is not at all prepared for the chances she must take .

title: Charming Tribute to Odd Introverts
review: It is hilarious and heart - warming to see her pursue and hide from the object of her desire , an eccentric wounded artist of a man who collects discarded photos from train stations and works part - time in a porn shop .

title: Charming Tribute to Odd Introverts
review: This movie is a pure delight .

title: Charming Tribute to Odd Introverts
review: Scenes of Montmatre and other parts of Paris often neglected in films evoke a wonderful feeling of that city for anyone who has visited , lived in Paris or left a part of their heart there . Go see it!~

title: What a joy!

This is a keeper .

review: Paris , however , is another story .

review: and it will be magical if Amelie is in charge of the event .

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: From French director Jean - Pierre Jeunet comes a film with the most original and sparkling look I"ve seen in a decade .

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: Using camera angles and colored filters we"ve come to associate with TV commercials -- the good ones -- Jeunet turns this romantic adventure of a young Parisian who"s afraid of intimacy into a visual whirlwind .

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: His film - making technique owes much of its inspiration to those small orbs of water we shake to see the snowfall , the flashing open - shut action of a painted Spanish fan , and the zig - zag movement of the skateboarder .

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: My favorite visual trick is the talking passport - size photos , not one , but four , images of a Spanish gent who dispenses advice to the love - lorn hero , brilliantly played by the endearing Matthieu Kassovitz .

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: The images and scenes pass with a speed the dazzles , as the young heroine Amélie pursues her many projects , whose goal is to improve the lives of ordinary Parisians who populate her life .

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: Her imagination works overtime , even as she herself becomes the target of another form of improvement -- falling in love .

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: The film has relatively little dialog ; verbal cohesion comes at crucial points from a slightly authoritative voice - over .

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: The wonder of the film is that it tells it story

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: and holds us viewers primarily through visual means , as well as the enchanting performance of Audrey Tauton in the title role .

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: And then there is that music , so charming it makes you sit through the credits that roll at the end .

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: And finally you sit in the theater , lit again

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: and reeking with the reality of spilled popcorn ,

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: and you wonder if you can"t just sit there ,

title: Fabulous? Absolutely!
review: and watch this wondrous escapade all over again .

Starting at the first shot showing a beautiful old street in Paris and the first extremely funny 15 minutes setting the characters and the location ( à la Magnolia ) to the surreal end of the movie ; everything is perfectly thought out and shot .

review: Tiersen"s score also has to get a lot of credit - the whimsical mix of quaint mouth organ and accordion pieces , contrasted with quieter , more sombre piano tracks sets the appropriate mood for this modern day fairytale .

review: I suppose many of us would like to pretend that we are Zorro , mask and sword and all , leaving a signature at the scene of a mysterious act of goodwill , or place ourselves in our own television documentary of a short but fulfilling life .

title: The Fabulous Destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: Even better , they all serve Amelie"s characterisation ; whether it"s pointing at her loneliness and insecurities of never finding love , or her nervous excitement after successfully pulling off her own heist , or just her eccentric curiosity , best visualised through a series of quick cuts of every orgasm in Paris in a single second .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: One of the most adorable , original & sweetest movies of all time , Amélie ( also known as Le Fabuleux Destin d"Amélie Poulain ) is a beautifully crafted , exquisitely narrated & gorgeously rendered tale about the simple things in life that usually are far more valuable than we deem it to be

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: and throughout its runtime , all it attempts to do is to make us pause & admire those small wonders that abound around us at all times .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: Presenting its peculiar story with irresistible charm & incomparable wonderment , Amélie is a celebration of life that is captured in such an inventive manner that every single frame of it is an aesthetic work of art & passion and with its insanely magical blend of all aspects , the film also triumphs as arguably the finest effort to come out from French cinema & certainly ranks amongst the greatest motion pictures of all time .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: The story of Amélie follows its titular character ; an innocent , young & extremely shy woman in her early twenties who , after making a surprising discovery in her apartment one day & using it for a certain good deed that pays off immensely well , dedicates herself to helping others find joy & happiness in their own lives in the most unexpected yet delightful manners while struggling with the isolation of her very own life .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: Directed by Jean - Pierre Jeunet , who incorporated chapters of his very own life into the film , Amélie is brought to life in a style that completely defies conventions from beginning to end .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: Throughout its runtime , it ponders on moments that seem irrelevant to the narrative at hand yet without those little snippets , Amélie wouldn"t be the same film for they add a great deal of sweetness into the picture & this level of unusualness is present in every single aspect .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: The screenplay is equally good with best parts being how it opens the story , introduces all its characters , paces the narrative & keeps it all glued together .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: Cinematography in itself is a heartwarming delight that exhibits rich , resonant & remarkable use of colour palette that captures Paris in stunning detail & vividness .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: Editing provides a refined pace to the whole film

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: and although its 122 minutes of runtime sounds fair , I wish this splendid beauty never ended .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: Coming to the performances , Audrey Tautou as Amélie Poulain is adorable beyond belief & effortlessly manages to win hearts with her extraordinary performance .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: Beautifully capturing the innocent , naive & shy nature of her character , it"s impossible for me to imagine someone else playing this role because Audrey turned out to be the very definition of Amélie as if she was born to play her .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: The immensely cute Flora Guiet also deserves a mention for she was equally amazing as young Amélie .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: And last but not the least is Yann Tiersen"s mesmerising score which seamlessly integrates into the narrative to further elevate the joyous , cheerful & pleasant ambiance present in the picture and , together with other aspects , effortlessly succeeds in transcending its viewers to an otherworldly experience for 2 hours .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: The storytelling is unique , the performances are superb , the music is powerfully evocative , the direction is simply impressive craftsmanship ,

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: and because of all that there"s no denying that Amélie delivers on all fronts .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: On an overall scale , Amélie is a celebration of selfless good deeds , the joy of little things , the satisfaction one gets in making a person smile

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: and how our actions can really inspire & change someone"s life forever .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: A whimsical journey & a life - altering drama that remains one of the most heartening & gratifying film experiences of my life , this is one masterpiece that left me smiling like a maniac like never before & I really mean it when I say that " Without Amélie , today"s cinema would be the scurf of yesterday"s " .

title: Without Amélie, Today's Cinema Would Be The Scurf of Yesterday's
review: One hundred percent recommended .

The removal of all that was especially noticeable since the film"s setting was shot in the big city of Paris .

title: Wicked
review: Amelie is a playful romp through the imaginative perspective of a girl who prefers her home dreamt fairy tale over reality .

title: Wicked
review: It has a childlike wonder to its narrative that does anything but undermine the more sophisticated workings of the plot .

title: Wicked
review: It has the bright and colorful palette of a little girl"s fantasy ,

title: Wicked
review: and it wears the mischievous smirk of a soul born to cause trouble .

title: Wicked
review: Every inch of this film embodies the spirit of its titular character .

title: Wicked
review: Early in the film , Jean - Pierre Jeunet introduces the main characters via the simplest method : a one on one introduction reminiscent of a first - grader"s story with the narrator naming the characters , informing the audience who they are , and listing their likes and dislikes ( and no , that is not a criticism ) .

title: Wicked
review: In the hands of another director , this would bore the audience to tears ( like so many other films have done ) ;

title: Wicked
review: but Jeunet is a visual filmmaker who understands that cinematic stories must been seen .

title: Wicked
review: So he punctuates each character"s introduction with an energetic camera that glides across the sidewalk to close in on each character , then quickly cuts to a sample of each bit of information ( likes and dislikes , and so on ) ending with Amelie smiling to the camera and answering the narrator , " Fifteen .

title: Wicked
review: " And in one sly move , Amelie has revealed that this film is an individual"s perspective on reality , and not reality itself : her voice may not be narrating ,

title: Wicked
review: but she"s definitely in on the retelling of her story .

title: Wicked
review: This is the rare film that has placed all hope of success on two factors : total unity from all aspects of its production and total disbelief from the audience .

title: Wicked
review: It"s the film that has to seduce its audience into believing that , in this world , the discovery of a forgotten treasure would lead to the revelation of Amelie"s purpose in life that Amelie would go so far out of her way in her schemes to make the world better ( by making someone else happy or someone deserving miserable ) rather than directly confronting the issues .

title: Wicked
review: Jeunet put out the call , and the cast , the DP , the composer , and all parties answered appropriately .

title: Wicked
review: Audrey Tautou in the lead role perfectly portrays that mischievous , sometimes malicious , woman who never fully grew up ( loved her malicious side .

title: Wicked
review: ) Ever evident in her eyes is that childlike fascination , curiosity , and passion to be a puppeteer manipulating the world around her that sense that her mind is forever at work figuring out how to pull all the right strings to return a photo album to its owner without directly handing it to the man ( to name one scenario ) .

title: Wicked
review: Tautou"s performance and her character overshadows the rest of the cast rightly so since , again , this is Amelie"s perception , her story , and her fantasy , and not an unbiased documentary of her life .

title: Wicked
review: Still , her world is populated with colorful characters appropriately exaggerated to match the exaggerated world they live in .

title: Wicked
review: I liked the tangent surrounding Joseph and Georgette in the diner who come together as a direct result of Amelie"s intervention , the artist ( the Glass Man ) who guides Amelie throughout the story , her downplayed father whose garden gnome takes a trip around the world and decides to send postcards , and the poor owner of the produce stand who falls on Amelie"s bad side .

title: Wicked
review: I enjoyed the film most because it was like watching an act of insanity , a life - threatening stunt that even David Blaine has rejected and declared impossible .

title: Wicked
review: This is a movie whose raw storyline begs a critical bashing - whose main character"s actions draws attention to itself and asks the question " why bother ? " The only way for Amelie to work is through its style - complete acceptance of Amelie"s perception over our own .

title: Wicked
review: All the pieces had to fit together to achieve the correct tone to make this happen ,

title: Wicked
review: and , lo and behold , Amelie gracefully and effortlessly succeeds .

title: Wicked
review: Like watching a disaster waiting to happen ,

title: Wicked
review: and witnessing a miracle .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: Amélie Directed by Jean - Pierre Jeunet Starring Audrey Tautou For what its worth , Amélie is a good example of what feel - good movies are supposed to be .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: Light , joyful , and easygoing , one can only think of his or her childhood to imagine the feeling the protagonist , Amélie Poulain , radiates .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: From the opening credits itself , you would already expect Amélie to be different than most people .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: You will laugh at her and her parents " eccentricities ,

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: yet you"ll feel melancholic after finding out that Amélie"s heart problem is nothing more than the desire to be hugged .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: In the later scenes , you will feel that Amélie exudes a distinct aura ; she seems to brighten up the place she goes to .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: Amélie"s attitude and upbringing sets the events of the movie .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: She finds happiness in the simplest of things .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: Also , it is her gift to bring joy to others , regardless of how simple or complicated the joys appear .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: But she doesn"t simply choose to help others ; it appears to be her fate .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: The movie is very specific with certain moments in time ,

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: and at these moments something beautiful happens .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: It"s as if the movie is telling us to live each moment in time to the fullest , because we will never know if this is the end .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: The lines were light and funny ,

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: and were well - performed by the cast .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: The film does not expound too much on lines -- a thorough analysis of the lines is minimally required to understand the character"s personality .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: Yet the only noticeable flaw in this movie is Amélie"s character .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: She could not do to herself what she has done to others .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: She helps others realize the intricate beauty of life too much that she can not see what the people she helped experience .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: This flaw ultimately balances Amélie"s character and makes her much more appealing and appreciated .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: The cinematography of Amélie is wonderfully constructed -- so much that many critics and fans consider the movie an moving artwork .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: Notable are the camera movements employed , such as zooming - in scenes in the introduction of Amélie"s parents .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: And the Paris backdrop is , needless to say , beautiful .

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: Amélie is a light - hearted , heart - filling wonder ,

title: Light, easy-going, feel-good
review: and is worth every cent and minute spent .

title: An amazing movie that you will never tire of watching
review: The film is an explosion of colour and a visual feast .

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: Who knew that such a quirky and original premise could evoke so much heart and creative expression ? From its opening shots of a dragonfly being squashed by a car on a beautifully winding brick road in Montmartre , the wind causing wine glasses to dance up and down on a restaurant"s tablecloth , and an elderly man erasing the name of an old friend out of his address book after his funeral , the viewers of Amelie know they are in for something both visually and literally stunning .

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: Truly , it was the camera - work of director Jean - Pierre Jeunet that initially captivates the viewer ( the whole scene in the rain on the bridge as Amelie"s mother pours her goldfish from the bridge into the creek is beautiful ; that gliding , overhead shot could be viewed over

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: and over again without losing its appeal ) , not to mention the vibrant colors of Paris and the quick exploration of wild tangents somehow related to the bigger story .

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: But after all is said and done ,

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: and the tricks of Jeunet have lost their initial luster , it"s the screenplay and the characters especially that cause the audience to remain captivated .

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: Audrey Tautou brilliantly evokes the oddball characteristics of Amelie Poulain without resorting to turning her into a hollow caricature .

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: Despite her eccentricities , Tautou"s performance helps the audience see elements of themselves scattered throughout her everyday feelings , longings , and , at times , actions that are so creatively translated to the screen in a type of visual symbolism that is almost so simple to comprehend ,

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: yet so difficult to evoke without dialogue .

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: In closing , this is an excellent movie ,

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: and an even better character study involving people who , despite living on the other side of the world , hold so much in common with ourselves .

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: If you feel discouraged by foreign films , please don"t let that stop you from seeing Amelie .

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: I honestly kept forgetting that I was even reading French at the bottom of the screen because I was so caught up in the visual style , story , and fresh bursts of comedy .

title: Amazing cinematography not only reason to see Amelie
review: This is simply a creative delight ! * * * . 5/ * * * *

review: Through a random series of events she decides to make people happy .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: On the 24th of March , 2002 , widely acclaimed " Amelie " did not win the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film of 2001 .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: That honor went to " No Man"s Land , " a story of civil war in Bosnia - Herzegovina , and the encounter of two Bosnians , a Muslim and a Serb ( Orthodox Christian ) .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: " No Mans Land , " may have been the better film ;

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: and its context of tragic civil war , with questionable US participation , apparently prevailed upon an often socially sensitive and responsive Hollywood .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: Conversely , " Amelie " received some local ( French ) criticism for the absence of a grittier urban setting -- real - life demographics and environment .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: The historic Monmartre district , with its landmark Sacre Coeur basilica , is highly popular with tourists and Parsians .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: On any given day , the streets of Monmartre are home to the affluent and the poor , drug traffic and crime , dirty air , street noise and litter , and descendants of Algerians , Moroccans , Senegalese , Tahitians , and Viet Namese , in addition to neighboring Europeans .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: It"s accurate and fair to cite the sanitized , picture - postcard qualities of the film"s on - location cinematography ;

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: but it should be added that " Amelie " is a spiritually and sensually uplifting film , a remarkable achievement of highest craft and quality with few equals .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: Within the world"s densest urban region ( Western Europe ) and the 18th most populated metropolitan area ( Paris ) , " Amelie"s " characters share a common malady -- the special loneliness and isolation borne by inner cities .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: The film"s primary focus is on symptoms of , or remedies for , this urban illness .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: The daily routines of cafe habitués , and the laughable , ribald scenes of sex -- real or imagined -- are sadly inadequate band - aids for meaningful relationships .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: We cheer for all of them -- from the less likable , Joseph and Collignon , to the winsome , Amelie -- to find someone to share love and happiness .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: " Amelie " is an impressionist film , rivaling the brilliantly colored impressionist paintings of Renoir , Toulouse - Lautrec , and Van Gogh .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: Director and film writer , Jean - Pierre Jeunet , floods our five senses ;

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: and he does not short change us on emotional content , especially when we study the faces of Amelie"s neighbors and customers .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: This is truly a remarkable display of sensitivities , skills , and both urbane and openly boyish , locker - room humor .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: Perhaps , M. Jeunet will attempt an inner city film in the near future , showing the darker shades of realism , with the open plumbing of humanity"s toil .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: This delightful and enchanting film must be seen by all who believe in the potential of forgotten and often overlooked members of the human race .

title: "--- Spiritually And Sensually Uplifting --- "
review: And we must remember to see " Amelie " with our children -- and our grandchildren -- sometime , when the time is right .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: After watching Amelie for the first time , I thought it was the best film of 2001 .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: After viewing it again a second time , with even more appreciation , I have come to believe that it"s one of the best films -- ever .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: And it"s French ! My God , Who would have believed it ? Amelie is a woman who lives in a fantasy world .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: Conditioned to behave this way in her childhood -- deprived of playmates , slung between a neurotic mother and an iceberg father -- Amelie prefers to dream , a personality trait that blossoms full - flower in adulthood .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: Amelie habitually retreats into the private world of her imagination , where she plays , like a lonely child without any friends .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: Now , I know what you"re thinking : this is another boring movie about family dysfunction and its long - term consequences , The Price of Tides with a French accent .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: But I"m delighted to inform you that it"s not .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: In fact , it"s the very the antithesis of such films .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: And it"s a work of uncommon brilliance for that same reason : it takes Amelie"s charming but mildly self - destructive idiosyncrasies -- her tendency to dream and remain an introvert , to ` mess up her life " with stratagems , play - acting , and meddling , habits unavoidably formed in the bosom of her family -- and shows how wonderful they are .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: That"s right , wonderful .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: Throughout the film , she is helped into the real world by the affectionate counsel of an archetypal ` wise old man ; "

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: but , along the way , her preference for fantasy over reality is treated with the grace and generosity of a culture that considers human failure inevitable , perhaps even necessary ; a culture with the courage to say , simply , ` that"s life .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: " ` I love the word fail " , " the barroom author says in an important but easily overlooked scene .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: It"s human destiny , he insists .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: Doing his best ` sidewalk Socrates , " he adds : ` Life is

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: but a draft , a long rehearsal for a show that will never play .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: " It"s the perfect , ingenious set up for the question facing Amelie : Will she fail , allowing herself to merge with the ebb and flow of universal woe , or will she ( through love it"s so French ! ) overcome her common destiny to fail ? I won"t spoil it for you .

title: Failure -- C'est La Vie
review: Find out for yourself .

title: How Romantical.
review: Ah , the French . So romantic , or least that"s the stereotype and the newest French film from the great director , Jean - Pierre Jeunet ( Delicatessen , City Of Lost Children ) , won"t put an end to that .

title: How Romantical.
review: In fact , it will perpetuate the belief beyond all reason .

title: How Romantical.
review: You see Amelie is a film that should melt the heart of the most frigid cynic ,

title: How Romantical.
review: but you know cynics , they just won"t let go of their hurt .

title: How Romantical.
review: The story involves a woman who discovers the ability to make other peoples " lives better ,

title: How Romantical.
review: but won"t use that power on herself . That"s the simple .

title: How Romantical.
review: The complex is the film itself .

title: How Romantical.
review: It is beautiful , colorful , quirky , funny , strange , moving , lovely and romantic as all get out .

title: How Romantical.
review: Each new conquest of Amelie"s is stranger and more complex than the last and almost all of them reward you with a great laugh or the ability to put yourself in her shoes and feel a sense of accomplishment of making others happy .

title: How Romantical.
review: However , as you sit there basking in the afterglow , you also feel the underpinnings and loneliness that she feels .

title: How Romantical.
review: She won"t let go of it .

title: How Romantical.
review: She doesn"t feel she deserves it , so she continues to manipulate others into happiness therefore she doesn"t have to deal with her own pain . Don"t fret though .

title: How Romantical.
review: Into Amelie"s life walks a man of mystery and good looks , who , from the moment they lock eyes , knows he must meet this wonderful and strange girl .

title: How Romantical.
review: Thus begins one of the most bizarre and fun courtships ever put to film .

title: How Romantical.
review: They put up posters around town asking to meet , play scavenger hunt and wear disguises all because Amelie isn"t comfortable with herself .

title: How Romantical.
review: Jeunet"s sense of timing and humor work well for this film .

title: How Romantical.
review: His quirky camera angles and movements and use of special effects actually add to the story and don"t distract .

title: How Romantical.
review: Plus he"s worked hard with his crew to bring color and amazement to Paris that could only be real in the movies .

title: How Romantical.
review: Don"t let the fact that it"s subtitled dissuade you from seeing Amelie .

title: How Romantical.

title: Amelie... who makes miracles... If you want to trust her...
review: Amelie , Amelie Poulain ... For ever I think that name will remain in my memory ... In my memory as a movie fan ... Because this is really a film you can"t avoid to fall in love with ... Well , it"s the worst thing I wish you :-))) I"m , usually very critical about french films ... I authorized myself to be critic because I speak french , my cultural background is french and though I"m not french ( I"m from Begium just at the border with France for those who don"t know LOL ) , and I think that the French cinema has made no master piece since a long time ... Up to Amelie This film is a wonder , a pure and rare perl coming from the imagination of a master of images , of dreams , of emotions , of directing , of casting ... Monsieur Jean - Pierre Jeunet .

title: Amelie... who makes miracles... If you want to trust her...
review: This film is a jump into happyness , into simple and lovely moments of everyday life , of everyday emotions ... You want to be ... Just happy , just like in your childhood , when you were playing with your barbie , or playmobils or eating your fav ice - cream or chocolate ... So ... Just watch Amélie ... She makes miracles ... Yes , true miracles .
