review: and lost we can all feel from time to time , for 2 hours , at least , my faith in humanity was restored ? I will not describe the plot in this post , or the characters .

title: Feelgood movie extraordinaire!!
review: All i will say is this : If you want to feel the childhood joy of simple pleasures , if you want to be swept up in an idealistic tide of joy , but without the syrup of countless imitations , if you want to feel alive again and smile without fear of embarrassment , go and see this movie .

title: Amelie
review: Amelie is a 2001 French film written and directed by Jean - Pierre Jeunet .

title: Amelie
review: Jeunet and Gullance Laurant ; the film is a whimsical and somewhat idealised depiction of the contemporary Parisian life .

title: Amelie
review: It tells the story of a shy waitress who decides to change the lives of those around her for the better , while struggling with her own isolation .

title: Amelie
review: Laurent and Jeunet use a kind of " magical " realism to give the movie an almost dreamy effect .

title: Amelie
review: The atmosphere of the film is also supported by the magnificent music by Yann Tiersen who had composed 19 songs in 15 days for the film .

title: Amelie
review: The music continually changes from somehow being joyful to at the same time becoming sad and slow and sometimes fast and exciting .

title: Amelie
review: The music supports every moment in the film

title: Amelie
review: and becomes a part of the fabulous world of Amelie .

title: Amelie
review: Jeunet established the dream like atmosphere by mostly using greens and reds and sometimes adding blues to set the contrast .

title: Amelie
review: Sometimes the use of colour gets very obvious ; like Amelies apartment for example it"s almost completely red , the underground stations are kept in green

title: Amelie
review: and the green grocery stores stand out from the grey buildings behind .

title: Amelie
review: Also Audrey Tautou ( Amelie ) mostly wears either bright red or bright green .

title: Amelie
review: Besides Jeunet use of colour to bring light in the film , his masterful camera work and few special effects , just adds that touch of fantasy to the movie .

title: Amelie
review: For example there is an astonishing high angle shot of Amelie flipping stones on the le canal in Paris .

title: Amelie
review: The camera shows a shot of her leaning on a fence , flying above her head then craning to a low angle shot to flipping stones in the direction of the camera .

title: Amelie
review: Another fantastic camera shot is seen when Nino is shown falling up the stairs chasing the yet to be discovered repair man .

title: Amelie
review: The camera shows the repair man driving off with Nino following close behind .

title: Amelie
review: Amelie then enters the picture running after Nino .

title: Amelie
review: The camera follows her , then turning around almost 180 degrees around shows her holding Nino"s bag that he had just lost .

title: Amelie
review: Also when Amelie sits in front of the station we see her in a long shot , the camera dollies in to fly over her head to an over - the - shoulder shot .

title: Amelie
review: Some of these camera movements are extremely effective supporting the dream like atmosphere , adding interesting aspects to ordinary actions .

title: Amelie
review: The few special effects incorporated in the movie were effectively showing the audience what was happening that could not be seen .

title: Amelie
review: Jeunet decided to show the key in Amelies pocket after copying it and bringing the original key back to the grocer"s door .

review: I keep trying to come up with comparisons ,

review: The director clearly feels the temptation to take us off into a fantasy , with Amelie magically making everything perfect for everyone ,

review: but always pulls his story and characters back to earth to remind us that the theme of his story is neither spiritual nor sexual but emotional - about the desperate need we all have to be recognized as special by at least one other person we feel is special .

title: Perfect romantic comedy

review: and great French directors incorporate this virtue into their films , as we see done here .

title: Perfect romantic comedy
review: Finally , it has to be said , there is nothing inaccessibly " arty " here , this is a very funny film .

review: This is a film that can appeal to everyone , on several different levels , and really needs wider exposure to a larger audience than hitherto . Very refreshing .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: Those of you who doubt that Paris , France is still the most magical and romantic city in the world should perhaps take a look at Jean - Pierre Jeunet"s film " Amelie " ( 2001 ) .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: In it , we meet a pretty , shy young woman , Amelie Poulain , who works in a Parisian coffee shop and whose favorite hobbies , we are told , are skipping stones , cracking open creme brulees , sinking her hands into sacks of grain , and daydreaming about all kinds of strange things .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: She soon becomes a combination secret benefactor , philanthropist , fairy godmother and protector for the unusual assortment of oddballs at her job and in her Montmartre apartment building ,

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: but is stymied when she meets and is attracted to an equally eccentric young man .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: Anyway , it is just as difficult to not use the word " charming " when referring to " Amelie " the film as it is to not use the word " adorable " when speaking of Audrey Tautou"s Amelie herself .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: Ms. Tautou brings to mind another Continental actress named Audrey ; yes , Audrey Hepburn .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: Indeed , in some shots , as when Amelie looks directly into the camera with that little mischievous grin , the resemblance really is something .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: Many magical things transpire in this highly amusing fantasy comedy -- lamps come to life , snapshots speak --

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: but I guess magical things can and WILL happen when a gal like Amelie is around .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: The film is remarkable to look at , with ingenious and colorful art direction , unusual camera angles , unexpected special FX , and -- need I even say?--lovely Parisian backdrops .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: It is also , surprisingly , at times laff - out - loud funny .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: This picture is certainly not your run - of - the - mill romantic comedy , but something truly special that manages the tricky blend of fantasy , reality , comedy and romance .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: I can"t imagine it not appealing to anyone with a heart and a sense of wonder .

title: A Magical Blend Of Fantasy, Reality, Comedy And Romance
review: A real winner , indeed .

title: Irresistible Mix Of Magical Realism, Comedy And Romantic Love Story
review: Jean - Pierre Jeunet had already established himself as a cult filmmaker with a very distinct visual and narrative style after he co - directed the two surreal , darkly funny " Delicatessen " ( 1991 )

title: Irresistible Mix Of Magical Realism, Comedy And Romantic Love Story
review: and " La Cité Des Enfants Perdus " ( 1996 ) with his buddy Marc Caro ,

title: Irresistible Mix Of Magical Realism, Comedy And Romantic Love Story
review: and he had even briefly ventured into Hollywood ( to mixed results ) with " Alien Resurrection " ( 1997 ) when he hit his stride

title: Irresistible Mix Of Magical Realism, Comedy And Romantic Love Story
review: and found unexpected mainstream success with the amazing " Le Fabuleux Destin d"Amélie Poulain " .

title: Irresistible Mix Of Magical Realism, Comedy And Romantic Love Story
review: " Amélie " is a wonder ; it"s a firework of clever ideas , beautiful cinematography and a love letter to the city of Paris .

title: Irresistible Mix Of Magical Realism, Comedy And Romantic Love Story
review: In my opinion it"s not really a mainstream film though , with Jeunet retaining his black humor as well as the surreal elements and distinct color grading from his previous films .

title: Irresistible Mix Of Magical Realism, Comedy And Romantic Love Story
review: But unlike in his two features with Marc Caro and his American movie , there"s a warm , beating heart throughout the whole film , and the resulting mix of magical realism , comedy and romantic love story proves just irresistible .

title: Irresistible Mix Of Magical Realism, Comedy And Romantic Love Story
review: On a pure filmmaking level , " Amélie " is a masterpiece .

title: Irresistible Mix Of Magical Realism, Comedy And Romantic Love Story
review: The cinematography is gorgeous and consistently inventive , the pacing perfect , the score beautiful and the fantastic cast of actors a joy to watch - especially Audrey Tautou .

title: Irresistible Mix Of Magical Realism, Comedy And Romantic Love Story
review: This is the kind of romantic comedy that even nerds like me can geek out about and without a doubt one of the best films of the first two decades of the new millenium . P

title: Let's All Help the Hopeless Among Us!
review: Here I am again : finally seeing a film that"s been on my " must see " list for almost 20 years .

title: Let's All Help the Hopeless Among Us!
review: Everything that can be said on IMDb has , most likely been said by now .

title: Let's All Help the Hopeless Among Us!
review: Personally , I found it the most delightful surprise on my list in many a year as I catch up with the history of cinema in which " Amélie " deserves a special place .

title: Let's All Help the Hopeless Among Us!
review: There were moments when I had to pause the DVD because I needed to stop laughing ( the visual " punchline " to the story of the mysterious man in the red shoes was there all the time and quite simple , but astoundingly breathtaking when revealed

title: Let's All Help the Hopeless Among Us!
review: and I couldn"t stop laughing for five minutes ) ,

title: Let's All Help the Hopeless Among Us!
review: and moments when I just had to regain my breath from the beauty which I had just witnessed .

title: Let's All Help the Hopeless Among Us!
review: This entire film is just one joy after joy after joy after joy .

title: Let's All Help the Hopeless Among Us!
review: I would like to suggest that I and the other 662 IMDb reviewers ( as of today ) who gave " Amélie " a rating of 10 stars should start a GoFundMe project or something like that - perhaps to open a clinic or start a hotline - dedicated to identifying and helping the 52 poor , miserable souls who gave the film a rating of 1 star find at least one moment of joy each day in simply being alive .

title: Let's All Help the Hopeless Among Us!
review: I would personally like to reach out to my German brother ( we speak the same language : I live in a nearby country ) whose justification for his rating of 1 star is that " Amélie " is not " Fight Club .

title: Let's All Help the Hopeless Among Us!
review: " Or perhaps he is too far gone by now ... Sad , sad , sad .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: Sometimes , you come across a film that you can relate to through such a personal , emotional , and even relatable level that it soon becomes a favorite of yours .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: Amelie is one of those films , as it manages to invoke a whimsical and optimistic charm from its titular character alone .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: The film itself remains the highest grossing French film released in America ,

title: Magnificent Magic
review: and it"s hard not to see why .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: As this is a vehicle for the delightful Audrey Tautou , the film depicts contemporary Parisian life in such a poetic fashion that it could make anyone change their life .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: The story itself focuses on a shy waitress named Amelie who , upon reuniting a man with his lost toy box , decides to change the lives of those around her for the better , despite struggling with isolation .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: Later on , she begins having feelings for a man named Nino , resulting her to play some sort of set up to win his heart while fighting with her inner shyness .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: I think shyness is the key word to describe how relatable Amelie truly is .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: She means well and is looking out for those she knows ,

title: Magnificent Magic
review: but still remains introverted and quirky , thus making it hard for her to relate to " normal " people , making her romance with Nino all the more unconventional .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: In addition , the first part of the film centers around Amelie"s childhood , which perfectly highlights her spending time alone to be entertained herself , further emphasizing just how relatable the film can be to any introvert .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: As for Audrey Tautou , she shines fantastically as Amelie , capturing her joyful albeit neurotic personality to such a lovable degree ,

title: Magnificent Magic
review: and it"s always fun to see her smiling .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: The other characters are charming in their own right , particularly Amelie"s reclusive neighbor Raymond Dufayel with brittle bones who tries finding the key to perfecting his repainted copy of Renoir"s Luncheon of the Boating Party .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: Other notable supporting characters are Amelie"s co - workers , from the hypochondriacal Georgette , to the stern albeit compassionate Gina , to the tough albeit caring owner Suzanne , in addition to the repugnant Joseph and the failed writer Hipolito .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: Whether it"d be Nino or these aforementioned characters , all of them stand out from their own distinct quirks , like collecting discarded photos , popping bubble wrap , or even lusting over one another through sex ,

title: Magnificent Magic
review: and it"s great that Amelie sees nothing but the joy in all that .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: Lastly , director Jean - Pierre Jeunet crafts a marvelous visual aesthetic ranging from playful camera techniques , compositional scenes , and even occasional computer animation , mostly for the creatures in Amelie"s imagination .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: These methods help give the film a very tongue & cheek presence by design , and cinematographer Bruno Delbonnel splendidly films Jeunet"s crazy vision to tremendous heights .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: Not to mention , although the film is very funny from its sardonic humor and characters alone , possibly the best jokes come from Amelie"s childhood , which subverts the most expectations through visual storytelling .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: The film truly knows when to have fun with itself , even through the visuals that perfectly define the dazzling world that Amelie sees in her daily life .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: Needless to say , dazzling sums up Amelie perfectly well , not just because of how enchanting it is by tone and design , but also by how sympathetic it is .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: It"s not often I"ve come across a film I can relate to given how introverted yet imaginative I myself am .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: If you yourself are an introvert or prefer to live life through the smallest and simplest of things , seek this magnificent beauty out and see whether or not it relates to you on a personal level or not .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: More often than not , I think it"s better that we just forget about much of the world problems

title: Magnificent Magic
review: and just look on the simplicities of life .

title: Magnificent Magic
review: You never know what aspects you"ll end up admiring .

title: Fabulous
review: One woman decides to change the world by changing the lives of the people she knows in this charming and romantic comic fantasy from director Jean - Pierre Jeunet .

title: Fabulous
review: Amelie ( Audrey Tautou ) is a young woman who had a decidedly unusual childhood ; misdiagnosed with an unusual heart condition , Amelie didn"t attend school with other children ,

title: Fabulous
review: but spent most of her time in her room , where she developed a keen imagination and an active fantasy life .

title: Fabulous
review: Her mother Amandine ( Lorella Cravotta ) died in a freak accident when Amelie was eight ,

title: Fabulous
review: and her father Raphael ( Rufus ) had limited contact with her , since his presence seemed to throw her heart into high gear .

title: Fabulous
review: Despite all this , Amelie has grown into a healthy and beautiful young woman who works in a cafe and has a whimsical , romantic nature .

title: Fabulous
review: When Princess Diana dies in a car wreck in the summer of 1997 , Amelie is reminded that life can be fleeting

title: Fabulous
review: and she decides it"s time for her to intervene in the lives of those around her , hoping to bring a bit of happiness to her neighbors and the regulars at the cafe .

title: Fabulous
review: Amelie starts by bringing together two lonely people -- Georgette ( Isabelle Nanty ) , a tobacconist with a severe case of hypochondria ,

title: Fabulous
review: and Joseph ( Dominique Pinon ) , an especially ill - tempered customer .

title: Fabulous
review: When Amelie finds a box of old toys in her apartment , she returns them to their former owner , Mr. Bretodeau ( Maurice Benichou ) , sending him on a reverie of childhood .

title: Fabulous
review: Amelie befriends Dufayel ( Serge Merlin ) , an elderly artist living nearby whose bones are so brittle , thanks to a rare disease , that everything in his flat must be padded for his protection .

title: Fabulous
review: And Amelie decides someone has to step into the life of Nino ( Mathieu Kassovitz ) , a lonely adult video store clerk and part - time carnival spook - show ghost who collects pictures left behind at photo booths around Paris .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Personal Experiences of Amelie Amelie is a beautiful story about a shy young woman who takes joy out of being a behind - the - scenes humanitarian .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Her unique ways of bringing happiness to people anonymously provide an overwhelming sense of charm to the big screen .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Even after stumbling across the love of her life , Amelie proves it to be too difficult to engage in a face - to - face interaction .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Amelie showed a few French New Wave characteristics throughout the film .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: For this writer , Amelie gave some appreciation toward director Francois Truffaut .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Most notably , Truffaut was a pioneer for using natural light and shooting outdoors instead of on set .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Director of Amelie , Jean - Pierre Juenet , constantly uses the outside world for filming locations .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: In addition to shooting outside , Truffaut once portrayed Paris as a perfect and fairytale - like atmosphere .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: According to IMDb , Juenet went to extraordinary lengths to clear trash , debris , and dirt before scenes in order to maintain that same fairytale feeling .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Every character in Amelie had great depth and detail .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: It seemed impossible to think that these characters were , in fact , fictional .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: The " Glass Man , " Lucien , and even the concierge and tape recorder man all had distinguished traits that made them unforgettable .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: The strangest and most effective form of the climax was the lack of dialogue between the two lead actors ( Amelie and Nino ) .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: It was bold and entirely different

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: but it kept the audience wanting Amelie and Nino to officially meet .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Amelie saw little gray in the world through her eyes .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: A black and white world was easier for Amelie as she judged the good vs. The bad people .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: The storefront owner was a condescending prick to his worker .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Amelie went to extreme lengths to make his life miserable at home .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: For example , Amelie would exchange his night slippers for a similar pair

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: but in a smaller size as well as switching the toothpaste tube with the foot cream tube .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Even Amelie"s father received the same treatment .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: Her father adored his garden gnome .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: With the help of her stewardess friend , Amelie was able to playfully terrorize her father with pictures of where the " escaped " garden gnome has been .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: The end message was trying to have her father travel the world before it is too late .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: This adorable film exploded with bright colors

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: and projected inimitable personalities .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: The strong Christian undertone heard throughout the storyline was unmistakable especially with Amelie"s humanitarian work .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: A film like Amelie reminds us how to really act towards one another .

title: Personal Experiences of Amelie
review: The simple concept of cause and effect , karma , and doing good deeds without the intention of recognition are the staples of life that should continually be practiced .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: Despite owning the Alien Quadrilogy boxset for a number of years , I have always found my self getting " stuck " in re - visiting Ridley Scott and James Cameron entries ,

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: but somehow never getting round to taking a look at Jean - Pierre Jeunet"s entry in the series .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: Recently finding out that Jeunet"s Amelie had been chosen as the next joint viewing on the IMDb Indian Cinema board , I prepared to at last enter Jeunet"s fantasy world for the first time .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: The plot : Getting herself a drink whilst turning on the TV , Amelie Poulain is shaken up , when she sees a TV channel coming in with breaking news about the death of Princess Diana .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: Dropping the bottle cap due to being so startled upon hearing the news , Poulain is surprised to discover that the cap has landed next to a compartment that she has never seen before .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: Checking the " secret " compartment , Amelie discovers the it contains an old metal " memory box " that a previous tenet , ( a young boy ) had hidden in the flat decades ago .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: Feeling a strong urge to track down the now fully grown man who hid the " memory box " , Amelie makes a resolution for herself : that if she is able to find the man and make him happy over the returning of the box , she will make sure to spend the rest of her life , being devoted to bringing happiness to others .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: View on the film : Promantly featuring a narration by Andre Dussollier for the first 40 minutes , writer"s Jeunet and Guillaume Laurant initially set the audience entering Amelie"s " world " on the wrong note , by making Dussollier"s narration overly detailed , which along with stopping the tremendous quirks of the characters from being unwrapped by the viewer , also leads to the movies opening Black Comedy moments losing their snap , due to the narration sanding down the comedic bite .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: Happily , once the narration has been put on mute , the writer"s allow Amelie"s enticing world to entwine the viewing .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: Smartly making the characters eccentric ,

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: but never knowingly " kooky " , the writer"s show Amelie break away from the sheltered life that Poulain has had since she was a child , as Amelie takes her resolution to heart of : " bringing happiness to others " , which leads to Amelie meeting tremendously distinct individuals such as a man who collects discarded photos from a photo booth , an artist with brittle bones who does repaints of Pierre - Auguste Renoir"s Luncheon of the Boat Party , and a costumer , who always sits at Poulain"s place of work , ( Café Des 2 Moulins ) with a tape recorder .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: Which he openly uses to loudly record his announce with a co - worker of Amelie"s , who also used to be his lover .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: Painting the film in bold green , yellow and orange colours , director Jean - Pierre Jeunet brilliantly uses the colours to show the organic way that Amelie"s friendships progresses , going from Poulain finding the box in a " sun - lit " yellow room , to meeting her unlikely love in a passionate , fully blossoming red room .

title: The Girl with the Glass of Water
review: Along with his excellent eye for colour , Jeunet also gives the film an enchanting fantasy atmosphere by having the camera move at a dazzling pace , as Amelie searches round Paris , to give the now fully grown boy , his long lost box of delights .

title: "Amelie" is a dreamers' destination!
review: From artful opening of a childhoods " imagination , director Jean - Pierre Jeanut and his bag of cine - tricks masterfully leads us through Amelie"s secluded little world of woe and wisdom and never skips a beat ! Our cute , but introverted , voyeuristic pixie ( Audrey Tautou ) , and the ideals she coyly holds onto , are exposed on this sweet romantic ride .

title: "Amelie" is a dreamers' destination!
review: It"s remarkably easy to relate to her self imposed underdog world and her escapism in taking on the role of avenger while impishly doling out good and some not - so good deeds .

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: Amelie ( 2001 ) After hearing wide acclaim for Amelie I finally came across seeing this strange yet passionate film .

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: My verdict : mixed .

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: Why ? I was not captivated , not interested enough , not impressed enough by the film"s unconventional cinematic techniques and to be brutally honest I thought it dragged on a bit when we did really know its outcome .

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: For me there just wasn"t enough there to hail the film a masterpiece or whatever else .

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: You may argue that it is a simple film ? Perhaps ,

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: but still it"s not that interesting .

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: It seems to me that whenever someone does something strange , like playing the film from end to beginning ( Memento ) , weaving three stories in non - chronological order ( Pulp Fiction ) or wondering on about strange , pointless things for 2 hours we always praise such films , never stopping and thinking .

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: One second , maybe I just watched some bullshit for 2 hours and not a masterpiece ? Undeniably unorthodox films do sometimes work ( Pulp Fiction )

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: but the majority of the times they do fail ... However praise must go to the technical aspects of the film : cinematography , sound , editing , stage design and the screenplay which in many respects is very good

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: but most importantly to the lovely and cute Audrey Tautou for creating a weird yet wonderfully colourful character .

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: This film may have been a total disaster without an appropriate lead actress .

title: An unorthodox, lovely little French film...
review: Modestly interesting , never groundbreaking . 5/10

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: Having spent the best part of the nineties making dark , dank , visual nightmares , French director Jean - Pierre Jeunet began the new millennium with a film so seemingly light - hearted and sweat natured that it managed to captivate many viewers who would not normally appreciate a French - language film .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: Others however have found it somewhat alienating , with a small fraction seeming highly critical of the unashamed romanticism and moments of fantastical abstraction .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: However , to view Amelie ( 2001 ) as a simple frothy farce - a modern day fairy - story with a contemporary edge - is missing the point somewhat ; neglecting the darker moments of the narrative and the prevailing feeling of alienation and melancholy that punctuates many of the more rose - tinted scenes .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: If we question the use of style here , it becomes apparent that there are two singular interpretations that you can take in enjoying this film .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: The first is the most simple and immediate ; the idea of an abstract fantasy , that envelopes the characters and presents the power of true love and imagination in all its colourful glory .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: The second interpretation is somewhat more difficult ; the idea that the more imaginative elements are symptomatic of the loneliness and intense sadness felt by the central character as she attempts to navigate herself through life .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: By extension , the way we approach the film depends very much on the way we approach the central character , whose attempts at goodwill and the process of shaping the course of life to suit her own thoughts and feelings will either seem charming and playful , or obsessive and unhinged .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: When I first saw the film I took it at face value ; I suppose , largely as a result of how different it was to the films that Jeunet had previously made with Marc Caro .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: However , after half a decade of watching and re - watching , it becomes incredibly clear that Amelie is a darker film than many would care to admit ; one that features suicide , illness , the death of Princess Diana , loneliness , ennui , obsession and a brief depiction of the sex industry , distorted and abstracted by an incredibly child - like perspective .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: You don"t have to see it on such a level - with the immediate interpretation being just as much fun -

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: but you can"t help but think that the scene in which Amelie sits on the roof of her building and fantasises about the sexual - climaxes of almost every single couple in Paris is somewhat uncomfortable , especially since the character is supposedly twenty - two ,

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: and not fifteen ! Likewise , the central character sees her own mother commit suicide , another character is bullied as a child ,

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: and then , of course , we have that other central character whose disability has made it impossible for him to leave the house for the vast majority of his adult life .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: For me , the film was more of a tear - jerker than something that made me leave the theatre with a warm smile on my face ; with the melancholic music of Yann Tiersen - with its accordions , horns , strings and toy - pianos - perfectly capturing the essence of this character trapped between childhood and adult life , and left alienated as a result .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: Even though everything in the film works out , to some extent , with the character ultimately achieving her goal , that final chord of the music and that odd glance to the camera seems pregnant with all kind of ideas of sadness and disappointment .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: Not disappointment in the situation ,

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: but disappointment in the inevitable realisation that life is never at a single constant ; it has ups and downs with one fleeting moment of perfect joy often followed by the same kind of sadness and hurt that is all too familiar .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: As I said , this interpretation is merely personal .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: It doesn"t take away from the experience that Amelie presents and the fantastic world that Jeunet is able to create .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: However , for me , this world works best as a piece of subjective abstraction .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: Obviously , those of us that have spent time in France know that their major cities look nothing like the one depicted here ,

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: and are in fact , closer to something like Pola X ( 1999 ) or In Praise of Love ( 2001 ) .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: With this in mind , Amelie reminded me of Jean Luc Godard"s first masterpiece Une femme est une femme ( 1961 ) , with the colourful use of mise - en - scene , costumes and production design - not to mention the subtle juxtaposition of iconography and genre references - all creating a mood and a tone that works towards disguising the more sad and tragic elements of both the character and the film .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: Regardless of how you choose to interpret the character , the central performance from Audrey Tautou is exceptionally rendered

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: and very much advantageous to the success of the film and the mood that it instils us with .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: Her movements , rhythms and expressions are as bold and as colourful as the direction of Jeunet ,

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: and yet , even here we see a sense of tragedy , cynicism and disappointment that mirrors that of the actual story .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: Nonetheless , the film is a definite must see work , if not for the bold and intelligent direction of Jeunet then for the fine performances from the likes of Dominique Pinon , Jamel Debbouze , Isabelle Nanty , Serge Merlin , Mathieu Kassovitz , Rufus , the gnome , etc .

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: Whichever interpretation you choose to follow with Amelie , there is no denying that the film is continually interesting , quirky and imaginative ,

title: Contrary to the general consensus; a melancholic and often disheartening film
review: and proves beyond all else that there is still intelligence and individuality present in contemporary film .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Amelie or Le Fabuleux Destin D"Amelie Poulain ( 2001 ): Audrey Tatou , Rufus , Mathieu Kassovitz , Lorella Cravotta , Clotilde Mollet , Jame Debbouze , Isabelle Nanty , Claire Maurier , Urbain Cancelier , Maurice Benichou , Dominique Pinon , Michel Robin , Armelle , Flora Guiet , Claude Perron , Andre Dussollier , Fabienne Chaudat , Dominique Bettenfeld , Jacques Viala , Sophie Tellier , Gerald Weingand , Paul Dare , Valeriane De Villaneuve , Isis Peyrade , Raymonde Heudeline , Sister Rosetta Tharpe , Jacques Thebault .... Director Jean - Pierre Jeunet , Screenplay Guillaume Laurant .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: When French director Jean - Pierre Jeunet"s Amelie was released in April of 2001 in the States , it became very popular , eventually becoming a lot like an instant foreign film classic .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Even today , college French classes view this film to expose themselves to modern French culture .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: In truth , this film does hold up a mirror to city life in Paris ,

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: but it"s not to be taken as absolute truth , especially because this film is straight out of a surrealist painting or a literary novel of meta - fiction / magic realism .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Everything that happens to Amelie , to Amelie"s social circle - her employer at the Cafe Deux Moulins , her co - workers , her boyfriend , her parents , her acquaintances - are " magical " incidents that seem to follow a pattern or ripple effect of good deeds / good kharma , or bad deeds / bad kharma .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Amelie tells the story of a young , lonely French girl in the working - class Montmartre district of Paris .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Her parents are bizarre and strangely detached from one another , from their daughter and from reality .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Amelie , too , has inherited these qualities

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: and she is a total free spirit , a pixie , frolicking from one end of Paris to another in search of pleasures and the chance to do a good deed .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: This humanitarian streak seems to come from her admiration of such figures as Princess Di , who in 2001 had been dead only about four years ( she died in Paris in a car crash )

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: and Mother Teresa who died around the same time .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: She discovers an diminutive small chest with photos of a young man who lived in her apartment in the 1950"s .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: She sets out to find that man and return his photos .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: This is the beginning of a series of good deeds Amelie performs .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Audrey Tatou is terrific in the role ,

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: but for the most part she is not really acting .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Much of the character of Amelie is mute and silent , like she"s either a silent film star or a weird sort of Parisian doll or mime .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: It was this role , however , that launched Audrey Tatou"s career .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Criticss and film lovers fell in love with her

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: and even dubbed her the new Audrey Hepburn , and it"s interesting to note how much she resembles the late Audrey Hepburn in physique and appearance .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: This comparison to Hebpurn is augmented by the final scene which finds Amelie and her new love riding on a motorcycle in Paris , surprisingly similar to the Vespa ride scene in " Roman Holiday " .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Recently , Ms. Tatou appeared opposite Tom Hanks in " The Da Vinci Code " ,

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: yet again set in Paris .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: So here"s the bottom line .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: This is a lovely , highly engaging film

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: but it"s a film that one can only enjoy as an acquired taste .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: To those who haven never seen a foreign film and have only watched American movies , watching Amelie as their first foreign film will be a bizarre and boring experience .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: The film exceeds the standard 2 - hour length of most films

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: and is hard to follow because so much is going on at once .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Often , the lines between reality and fantasy are blurred in this film .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: This can be confusing and frustrating to some viewers .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: But even so , this film is great for various reasons .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: There is as much reality in this film as there is fantasy .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: The French denizens of the city work in amusement parks , cafes , clothing stores , book shops , etc much like in any other city , have psychological issues , have sex , use public phones with telecards like in real life , and behave like real people .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: But the magic is subtle and effects their lives , toys come to life , blind men are able to see , champagne glasses dance on their own , etc .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: A real winner is the lovely , authentically Parisian music - mostly accordion - by Yann Tiersen , and the outstanding , vibrant color cinematography by Bruno Delbonnel as well as the equally gorgeous art direction by Volker Schafer .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: It is a Paris with wonders to be found everywhere , a magical Paris straight out of an illustrated children"s book .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: So , even if the film is weird and long , make Amelie one the foreign films you just have to see .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Keep in mind that this film is rated R and the much of the material is strictly for adults , namely the nudity and sexuality depicted in a few scenes .

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: Director Jean Pierre - Jeunet outdid himself with this one

title: Magic Realism In French Film: Amelie
review: and Amelie stands as one of his most famous and commercially successful films .

title: Stellar film
review: Fabuleux destin d"Amélie Poulain , Le , better known in the USA as Amelie , is a stellar film by French filmmaker Jean - Pierre Jeunet .

review: The story and dialogue itself is very smart ,

title: Stellar film
review: but what really did it for me was the usage of color and composition .

title: Stellar film
review: This is truly a great lesson in cinematography .

title: Stellar film
review: The main colors in the film are green , red , yellow , B / W ( not technically a color

title: Stellar film
review: but a lack of ) , and blue .

title: Stellar film
review: While green and red are used most ( which I think signifies Amelie"s moods and her view of her world ) , yellow is also used frequently ( signifying neutrality ) , with blue only used sporadically ( it signifies an important event or object - i. E. Nino"s bag ) .

title: Stellar film
review: The shot choices which brings these colors to life are also top - notch - you can freeze frame each frame of the movie

title: Stellar film
review: and it will ALL be fascinating just to stare at .

title: Stellar film
review: Truly a visual masterpiece - highly recommended , 9 out of 10 .

I just can"t understand the negative comments about this film .
It"s a film that really makes a positive statement about life .
I think I would have to have a very cynical view on life to find fault with it .
I"m glad this is # 27 in the top 250 , especially as more " popular " trilogies get three entries when they should have 1 , as they are really the same film .

This film is not a blockbuster , it"s not full of action , it"s not crammed with special effects , it"s not full of badies being shot by goodies , and and does not have the Hollywood machine behind it .

and is acted wonderfully .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: * SLIGHT SPOILERS * This is a modern - day fairy - tale of a simple city - girl , in a seemingly idyllic backdrop , which actually is ruffled is a lot of ways , due to its rather " disturbed " characters , whose lives , while this beady - eyed waitress tries to solve , finds herself in a similar situation , where she herself ends up needing some help .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: AMELIE can be considered a story of stories , tied together by just a single link , in the form of a girl called Amelie .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: Living in her own shell , this girl discovers the Samaritan in her , when she successfully tracks down

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: and gives the previous occupant of her apartment , a box containing objects of his childhood playthings that she accidentally finds in her house ,

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: and brings out the tears of joy in his eyes , as he reminisces his days of childhood , watching

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: and feeling the contents of the box .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: This experience overwhelms her , and she decides that she would now on , do whatever she could , to straighten other people"s lives , and herein lies the stories , which make the story of the movie .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: The movie is made up of bits and pieces , showing the rather weird nature of the various people , that Amelie tries to help .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: The magic of the movie lies in this aspect of how beautifully each character is depicted , with some handicap or the other disturbing their lives , which this lonely but good - willed girl tries to fix .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: Be it the " obsessed " neighbor , who is more than happy to read out letters from her deal husband , or the painter , who is so touchy about how names are pronounced , or the bullying vegetable - vendor , always belittling his hapless assistant , or the loveless boyfriend and the loveless hotel - waitresses , or the young man , who sifts for torn photographs of people , and reassembles and sticks them in the album that he maintains of reassembled photos of people he doesn"t even know , or even Amelie"s own father , who is obsessed with his ceramic gnome , each one of them is so carefully and delicately defined , that it overshadows the ambiguity in the story , which is what it intends to do , in the first place .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: Though the story has a naïve fairy - tale - like feel to it , it actually turns out otherwise , by its messed up characters .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: Hence , the movie , far from being a sappy and drab tale of feel - good , is actually quite an interesting take on the most unusual and uncanny facets of the human nature .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: Moreover , the slick cinematography and the music - video like feel of the movie , coupled with the swanky voice - over comments make it not only a visually splendid movie ,

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: but also an exciting joyride , with a lot of areas worth pondering on .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: AMELIE has a mischievous undertone , with a visually pleasing and amiable exterior .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: When one sees beyond the pleasing epidermis of the movie , it provides for interesting food for thought , when it comes to analyzing the bizarre characters in it .

title: SMART ENTERTAINER
review: For its glossy appearance , or for its underlying unapparent starkness , or for its feel - good aura , or just for its wacky imagination , AMELIE is an entertainer with brains and brawns . Rating : 9/10

Vive L'Amour, Vive Amélie!
review: " Amélie " is a French import that caused quite a sensation , and with good reason ! It"s a whimsical and surreal love story , showing Paris as a strange and wonderful place .

title: Vive L'Amour, Vive Amélie!
review: The star is the button - cute Audrey Tatou , whose presence is undeniable .

title: Vive L'Amour, Vive Amélie!
review: She loves the camera , and it loves her right back ! The story has Audrey"s character , Amélie Poulain , a waitress in Monmarte , who learns of the death of Princess Diana , and shortly thereafter , gets inspired to do good for people .

title: Vive L'Amour, Vive Amélie!
review: The writing is quirky but fascinating , examining the many eccentricities of the characters .

title: Vive L'Amour, Vive Amélie!
review: And the imagery is truly inspired , presenting a beautiful dream before your eyes .

title: Vive L'Amour, Vive Amélie!

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: This is a delightful romantic fantasy of love and comedy , of vivid color and some preposterous antics of love and friendship that will send mawkish tears down your cheeks while making you laugh out loud .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: If not , turn in your headset for a heart .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: Audrey Tautou is Amélie , a fashion - sharp Parisian waitress with an impish heart of gold and an shyness born of a bizarrely restricted childhood .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: She is cute and innocent , but not too innocent .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: Her father , who was a physician , thought she had a defective heart because every time he put the stethoscope to her little chest it was beating wildly .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: A voice - over explains that this was caused by the excitement that Amélie felt because her frigid father , whom she wanted so much to hold her , although he never did , was actually touching her .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: Because of an imagined heart condition she is kept out of school

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: and tutored at home .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: After her mother dies from being hit by a falling body ( an actual human body on its way to the pavement from a tall building ) we are flash - forwarded to the present where we find little Amélie all grown up .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: She still has no love in her life .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: But one day while listening to a news report of the death of Princess Di she drops something on the floor of her apartment .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: It rolls against a tile in the bathroom , dislodging the tile .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: Amélie pulls down the tile and finds in a hole in the wall a little tin box full of a boy"s childhood mementoes from many years ago .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: In a characteristic bit of inspiration she decides to find that little boy , now grown into middle age ,

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: and give him the box .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: But she is shy and so must invent a stratagem .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: She arranges to call him when he is near a public phone booth in which she has placed the box .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: So delighted with the joy she has given him , Amélie sets off on a series of inventive and pixie - like intrusions into the lives of others in order to bring them happiness and even love .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: While this R - rated fantasy would delight children there is too much actual sex in it for most American moms to tolerate for their little ones .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: In fact in the French style sex is made innocent ,

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: and of course that will not set well with those of a prudish nature .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: Favorite corny pun : " Even artichokes have hearts .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: " Favorite elaborate joke : sending her father"s garden gnome on the world tour that he won"t take himself , and having the gnome photographed at tourist sites

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: and the photos sent airmail to a very perplexed dad .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: Favorite joke : the beggar refusing a handout saying he takes Sundays off .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: Favorite scheme : reconstructing through cut and paste and photocopy the words of the landlady"s beloved , and then fashioning a last love letter to her from him that was lost in the mail for forty years .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: The two disc set includes a wealth of information to delight afficionados .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: There"s an interview with director Jean - Pierre Jeunet , some footage on how Amélie was made , filmographies of cast and crew , audition footage , etc . , etc .

title: Funny, heart-warming and strikingly original
review: Bottom line : very funny , heart - warming and strikingly original .

Thank you Lars von Hegnet for making me go see it ! Thank you Jean Pierre Jeunet - for making my world so much better ! This movie is my drug ! Shouts ! !

title: Words can't describe it...
review: and trust me i"ve seen many - many movies ! ! So what is it all about ? The movie tells us the story of Amelie from the moment she was conceived ( in perhaps the most clever scene i"ve ever seen ) " till , well , the present .

review: Amelie lives in a very beautiful world filled with strange people , from her father who never goes out of the house

title: Words can't describe it...
review: and spends his time building some sort of mausoleum for her deceased mother to the jealous guy at " Les Deux Moulins " cafe everyone is unique and as far away from normal as you can imagine ! Amelie is a waitress in the aforementioned cafe

review: and at she finds pleasure at helping out everyone around her who needs her help and making them happy always in her own way .

title: Words can't describe it...
review: For example she punishes the grocer for being harsh to his retarted employee and in one of the best scenes i"ve ever seen she gives a blind man the tour of her neighborhood .

title: Words can't describe it...
review: But when she falls in love , she is unable to help herself and confess her love to Nino proving that although she tries to make everyone else happy , she doesn"t have the guts to take the risk to try

title: Words can't describe it...
review: and make HERSELF happy .

title: Words can't describe it...
review: So what makes Amelie stand out ? First of all its unique art direction .

title: Words can't describe it...
review: Everything is simply beautiful , from the streets of Monmarte to the design and decoration of her house everything is beautiful .

title: Words can't describe it...
review: The scenery combined with the Jean - Pierre"s direction and Yan Tierssen"s excellent soundtrack give the sense of being in a dream , not an absurd dream like a David Lynch movie but a beautiful from which you would never want to wake up ... Then there is Amelie herself ... Audrey Tautut is without doubt the most perfect woman .

title: Words can't describe it...
review: From the way she looks to the way she moves and talks , she is not acting trying to be Amelie , she IS Amelie , it"s like the part was written especially for her even though she was selecte among thousands of other actresses ... Then there"s the direction which is perfect with a lot of clever touches throughout the film ( such as showing us her beating heart when she meets Nino or the way the various flashbacks kick in ) clearly this movie wouldn"t be half as good if it weren"t for all these factors plus , the music ! ! Never have i seen a most suiting soundtrack for a movie .

title: Words can't describe it...
review: In the end as you"ve probably assumed every little ellement and detail has been carefully selected , nothing is there by accident and nothing from a street poster to an actor feels like it shouldn"t be there .

title: Words can't describe it...
review: Bottom line is that Amelie is more of an experience than a movie .

It is the story of the lovely but introverted Amelie Poulain ( Audrey Tautou ) , who grew up as the only child of emotionally repressed parents , who wouldn"t let her have a goldfish because its suicidal tendencies stressed them out too much .

title: Sublime!!!
review: She eventually leaves home , and when the film begins , she is a waitress in Montmatre in a cafe called the Two Windmills .

review: She uses a garden gnome , a polaroid camera and the help of a stewardess friend to convince her father to travel the world .

title: Sublime!!!
review: but passionate customer ( played by Dominique Pignon from Delicatessen - he"s hilarious ! ! ) .

title: Sublime!!!
review: And along the way , she finds a photo album belonging to Nino ( Matthieu Kassovitz ) , an eccentric young man who collects discarded passport photos from photomatic machines in the metro stations ,

title: Sublime!!!
review: and reassembles them .

title: Sublime!!!
review: He may just be her soulmate .

title: Sublime!!!
review: In order to bring him closer she engages him in her own brand of cat - and - mouse flirtation ,

title: Sublime!!!
review: yet is terrified of actually succeeding .

title: Sublime!!!
review: Nino , however , is determined to get to know her and put the game to an end .

title: Sublime!!!
review: More than anything , Ameilie looks beautiful as a film .

title: Sublime!!!

title: Life is beautiful.
review: Audrey Tautou is Amélie Poulain , a pretty young girl in Paris who"s lonely and emotionally withdrawn .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: She works in a cafe and watches the world go by

title: Life is beautiful.
review: and sees how everyone else is lonely too .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: One day she happens upon a small tin box hidden in the wall by the little boy who lived in the apartment many years ago .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: It contains toys , pictures , and other mementos of his youth .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: She wonders what it would be like if he were to see these things again , so she tracks him down

title: Life is beautiful.
review: and arranges for him to discover his tin box in a phone booth .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: He"s overjoyed and shaken from his life"s sadness ,

title: Life is beautiful.
review: and it hits her - she can step into other people"s lives in secret and make them happy .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: So she sets out to help those around her .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: The lonely woman downstairs who misses her husband , the lovestruck man who hangs out at her cafe , the mousy girl working behind the counter , the frustrated artist downstairs , the man in the Metro who collects torn pictures people throw away .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: My favorite is her father , who"s given up on life since his wife died

title: Life is beautiful.
review: and who lives alone as a recluse for the most part .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: Amélie steals his garden gnome and gives it to a stewardess friend , who takes it around the world with her and mails him pictures of the gnome having a good time everywhere .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: It shakes him up and he decides to travel to all the places he"s wanted to visit but never had the nerve to do alone .

title: Life is beautiful.
review: But Amélie hasn"t taken care of her own needs , her own loneliness .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: I can see exactly how this film appeared as such a breath of fresh air to mainstream film - goers , riddled with the alternating crudity and blandness of American romantic - comedies ,

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: and the non - existence of a British template .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: Hopefully , the astounding success of this film will encourage people to look out for films from other countries .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: It should be remarked that " Amelie " is quite an artificial sort of French film ; it plays its French - ness and difference as a trump card .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: The Paris conveyed is a beautiful cinematic conjuring trick - not to say that the city isn"t a fine place ,

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: but its joie de vivre here seems so exaggerated that it takes on the depth of a sculpted cartoon .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: Visually , this can do no other than beguile you ; the essence of innocence and early summery romance are captured in this film .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: It is a picture fully geared towards an international audience , as well as a domestic one ; offering sheer escapist bonhomie and archetypal gallic qualities .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: It has the mark of intellect and " Art " in its wonderful composition ,

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: and in the cast of characters - the wise , comic old artist enraptured by his Renoir .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: Yet , mundanity is given a gleeful pinch of whimsy with the old garden gnome subplot and the photograph album"s resolution .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: The only really central character in this stylized tableaux is Amelie Poulain , played by Audrey Tautou .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: Tautou does carry it ; investing this almost superhuman , slightly manic and melancholy pixie with a great deal of charm .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: Part attractively coy , part knowingly wry and mischievous , she"s like a perfect confection ,

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: and we of course know she"ll end up with some romance in her life .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: This is Paris , after all .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: This is dealt with well , as it comes to her almost despite herself ; her nimble do - gooding proves her to be very much the ideal worthy person we ourselves aspire to be .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: The other actors largely give pictorially effective , comic cameos ; as players in this feelgood procession of events ; Audrey Tautou has to add some gravity and maintain the mood of levity .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: A difficult task well carried out by the actress ; the moments that most move are when Amelie is too coy to take the romantic initiative - she does have things to learn , despite her general excellence as a person .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: " Amelie " is a perfectly crafted and poised popular film ; perhaps overly calculated .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: But , a definite spot of enjoyable old - style entertainment , that will go down well with pretty much everyone with a romantic soul .

title: Very charming Parisian antics.
review: It"s an idealistic view of French - ness that can not fail to appeal in these Hollywood - homogenized times .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: " Amelie " is one of those films whose theme more or less boils down to " Live Your Life ! " It"s kind of an amorphous sentiment ( how exactly does one live anymore than they already are ? ) , one which is very hard to pull off without feeling pretentious or overly sappy .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: Thankfully , " Amelie " pulls it off .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: Part of the reason for this is Audrey Tautou .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: As the title character , a woman who was starved for emotion and companionship most of her life but who manages to retain a tenderness in spite of the fact , Tautou displays a mix of innocence and cleverness , shyness and daring , which makes the character work .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: Her Amelie is believable as a woman who wants to make other people happy

title: Strange yet sweet
review: but can"t bring herself to connect with them directly .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: This leads her on a variety of amusing and surreally complex escapades , including leading a man on a wild goose chase to restore a cherished photo album to him , or serving comeuppance to a mean - spirited grocer by sneaking into his house and altering small but significant details in his furnishings .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: The owner of the photo album is Nino , who ultimately becomes Amelie"s love interest .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: The album itself contains not family photographs ,

title: Strange yet sweet
review: but pictures strangers discard outside instant photo booths .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: The album is a prominent image in a film where isolation and voyeurism are the key motifs ( the film is set shortly after the tragic death of Princess Diana , who in the realm of " life as a spectator sport " was one of the biggest games in town ) .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: The symbolism here is wonderfully nuanced

title: Strange yet sweet
review: but occasionally heavy - handed , as in the case of a recluse known as " The Glass Man " who functions as Amelie"s concious .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: Other characters include a hypochondriac , a bitter customer at the cafe where Amelie works , and Amelie"s father , all of whom fit into the overall theme of embracing life .

title: Strange yet sweet
review: Some figure it out , some don"t -- finding out which is which is a journey worth taking .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: I have been a fan of Jeunet for years , ever since I saw Delicatessen on the Independent Film Channel .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Jeunet has been a master storyteller , illustrating his stories brilliantly with dark , rich colors .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: " Le Fabuleux destin d"Amélie Poulain " is no exception .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Instead of giving the typical synapsis that has already been repeated in the prior posts , I will tell why this film along with the others have given me such an affinity for Jeunet"s work .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: The films Delicatessen , La Cité des Enfants Perdus , and Le Fabuleux Destin d"Amélie Poulain are dark movies .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: The colors are dark and each character has a flaw , but there is always the protagonist that has a bright color to them and brings light to the story .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Whether it"s Louison the clown , One the strongman , or Amélie the dreamer , they all bring a sense of light

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: and hope into the lives of the other characters .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: The cinematography of these films is also rich and beautiful .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: The scenes can be dark and ancient - looking

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: and still be gorgeous .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: What might otherwise seem scary looks like wisened beauty that plays as the perfect background to the story such as the box full of memories and the hole where it was found or a photo album full of distorted or torn pictures pieced together ,

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: but not quite to their original state .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Another characteristic of Jeunet"s movies that I like are the facial expressions of his characters .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: While a minor detail , they add so much to the film .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Look back at the expression on Amélie"s face when she holds up the spoon that she uses for cracking the top surface of her creme brulée , the look on Dufreyal"s face in his video .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: On Nino"s face when he first encounters Amélie .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Of young Amélie when she has to say goodbye to her only childhood friend at the bridge .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Of Blubber as he looks up at Amélie sadly ( who would have thought a goldfish could look so sad and betrayed ) .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Jeunet"s films are also known for their sounds .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Of voices , sound effects , and of course , the beautiful music he chooses as the backdrop for his stories .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Yann Tiersen"s music matches the mood of its characters who are classic French with a touch of modern quirkiness .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: It consists of the accordion matched with rhythms that are both haunting and charming , of bells that sound with the innocent , child - like ideals of Amélie ,

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: and holds moods that play up those being expressed in the scenes in which they are played .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Jeunet has turned his film into a beautiful display of art that works on many different levels with varying shades of nuance .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: He has proven again of just how much of an artist he is through the people he chosen to create his vision and how beautifully he has orchestrated these elements into creating his newest masterpiece " Le Fabuleux Destin d"Amélie Poulain " .

title: Another work of art, painted by Jeunet et al
review: Un Fabuleux Destin indeed .

review: After all , almost every film on my top - ten list of the year -- Memento , The Royal Tenenbaums , Ghost World , and The Man Who Wasn"t There -- had either been completely ignored by the Academy or over - shadowed by a more politically correct competitor .

review: I skimmed over a review of Amelie on Amazon .

review: Com and , if I recall correctly , the author responsible for it had described it as a " French cartoon .

review: " For some this may seem accurate .

review: But in my humble opinion , Amelie is far more emotional than the over - hyped No Man"s Land could ever dream of being .

title: Fabuleux Destin d'Amelie Poulain, Le (2001) [Directed by Jean-Pierre Jeunet]
review: Perhaps I"m saying this because I can relate so well to the title character , or maybe it"s because I can"t stand to watch an actress as loveable as Audrey Tautou cry .

review: But regardless what it is , Jean - Pierre Jeunet is a genius ( even though I"m still trying to figure out how he could have been the same guy responsible for Alien : Resurrection ) .

review: In Amelie he has crafted a beautiful , humorous , and extremely romantic story that truly qualified for its Best Screenplay nomination ( although Memento was the only one good enough to actually deserve winning it ) .

review: Combining accordions , harmonicas , and strings , Yann Tiersen crafted one of the most unique and marvelous scores I"ve ever heard .

title: Brilliant
review: After watching Amelie for the first time , I thought it was the best film of 2001 .

title: Brilliant
review: After viewing it again a second time , with even more appreciation , I have come to believe that it"s one of the best films -- ever .

title: Brilliant
review: And it"s French ! My God , Who would have believed it ? Amelie is a woman who lives in a fantasy world .

title: Brilliant
review: Conditioned to behave this way in her childhood -- deprived of playmates , slung between a neurotic mother and an iceberg father -- Amelie prefers to dream , a personality trait that blossoms full - flower in adulthood .

title: Brilliant
review: Amelie habitually retreats into the private world of her imagination , where she plays , like a lonely child without any friends .

title: Brilliant
review: Now , I know what you"re thinking : this is another boring movie about family dysfunction and its long - term consequences , The Price of Tides with a French accent .

title: Brilliant
review: But I"m delighted to inform you that it"s not .

title: Brilliant
review: In fact , it"s the very the antithesis of such films .

title: Brilliant
review: And it"s a work of uncommon brilliance for that same reason : it takes Amelie"s charming but mildly self - destructive idiosyncrasies -- her tendency to dream and remain an introvert , to ` mess up her life " with stratagems , play - acting , and meddling , habits unavoidably formed in the bosom of her family -- and shows how wonderful they are .

title: Brilliant
review: That"s right , wonderful .

title: Brilliant
review: Throughout the film , she is helped into the real world by the affectionate counsel of an archetypal ` wise old man ; "

title: Brilliant
review: but , along the way , her preference for fantasy over reality is treated with the grace and generosity of a culture that considers human failure inevitable , perhaps even necessary ; a culture with the courage to say , simply , ` that"s life .

title: Brilliant
review: " ` I love the word fail " , " the barroom author says in an important but easily overlooked scene .

title: Brilliant
review: It"s human destiny , he insists .

title: Brilliant
review: Doing his best ` sidewalk Socrates , " he adds : ` Life is

title: Brilliant
review: but a draft , a long rehearsal for a show that will never play .

title: Brilliant
review: " It"s the perfect , ingenious set up for the question facing Amelie : Will she fail , allowing herself to merge with the ebb and flow of universal woe , or will she ( through love it"s so French ! ) overcome her common destiny to fail ? I won"t spoil it for you .

title: Brilliant
review: Find out for yourself .

title: A delightful romantic comedy
review: When watching foreign language films , I like to experience them in their native language rather than in the English - dubbed version .

title: A delightful romantic comedy
review: If it is dubbed , it takes away the sense of originality and beauty that was intended to be portrayed to the audience in the original script .

title: A delightful romantic comedy
review: It allows for the performances to be more accurate and at the same time , more enjoyable .

title: A delightful romantic comedy
review: In Amelie , we are taken through the lifestyle of a woman with a huge imagination who in reality is only a waitress at a small French coffee shop .

title: A delightful romantic comedy
review: We are taught to believe that she does not care about the huge things in life , which in this film is Princess Diana"s death , and that she only cares about the people around her .

title: A delightful romantic comedy
review: Throughout the film , she tries to help them improve their lives

title: A delightful romantic comedy
review: and in the process , try to improve her own .

review: It is a beautiful portrait of the human spirit

title: A delightful romantic comedy
review: and how one person can make a difference in another person"s life .

review: Amelie was played by a lovely French actress named Audrey Tatou , whom in my opinion should have garnered a Best Actress nomination for this movie .

review: She is able to successfully portray a shy woman who is willing to do anything to see her friends happy .

review: Amelie uses clever tactics to enlighten the people she loves and irritate the people she hates .

review: However , until the very end of the movie , her shy personality prevents her from experiencing happiness of her own .
