review: Whether the title character ( played with wide - eyed whimsy by Aurdrey Tautou ) is having her heart examined by her physician father , skipping stones across a canal , playing matchmaker for lonely hearts , reuniting worn down old men with their innocent past , or even torturing those who deserve it , the direction and acting keep the movie rapidly moving along with such emotion , exuberance , and charm that one forgets he is watching a movie

title: Charm, Charisma, Beauty & Heart Gather Under a Blue Parisian Sky
review: and gets completely drawn in .

title: Charm, Charisma, Beauty & Heart Gather Under a Blue Parisian Sky
review: All this despite the fantastical nature of the film and its characters .

title: Charm, Charisma, Beauty & Heart Gather Under a Blue Parisian Sky
review: It is rare that a film can be so charming and affecting without being overly sentimental .

title: Charm, Charisma, Beauty & Heart Gather Under a Blue Parisian Sky
review: The charisma , humanity , and palpable love of life of the title character and director allow this film to shine .

title: Charm, Charisma, Beauty & Heart Gather Under a Blue Parisian Sky
review: Nearly every scene bursts with heart and vivid beauty under a romanticized Parisian backdrop .

title: Charm, Charisma, Beauty & Heart Gather Under a Blue Parisian Sky
review: If you can not enjoy this film , then perhaps you too need your heart examined .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: Amelie ( Audrey Tautou ) is a winsome young woman who works as a waitress in a small Parisian bistro .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: Raised by a nervous mother and a doctor father ( Rufus ) , the only attention she was given as a child was when he would give her an annual medical check - up .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: This fleeting display of love would make her heart beat so fast that her parents believed she was sick , too sick to go to school , so Amelie created her own fantasy world , filled with danger and adventure .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: Amelie glides through her adult life unaware that the loneliness she carried as a child is slowly building inside her , until one day , after hearing of the death of Princess Diana , Amelie decides she must do something to help herself .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: This she does , by helping other people .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: After finding a small box hidden in the wall of her apartment , Amelie decides she will find the original owner

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: and return it to them .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: This she does anonymously Watching from afar , Amelie sees the overjoyed impact this has on the old man , who is reunited with his prized childhood possessions ,

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: and from this , she is hooked , hooked on helping the people closest to her .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: However , when Amelie sees an old friend , who as a child was an outcast similar to herself , Amelie"s beating heart once again goes into overdrive .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: The man is Nino ( Mathieu Kassovitz ) .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: Nino works for the most part in a sex shop in the lower part of town ,

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: but his major hobby is collecting the discarded pictures from public photo booths , and assembling the images in his scrapbook .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: Both Amelie and Nino would appear to be made for each other ,

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: but still Amelie is unable to approach him .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: Instead she decides to follow him around ; playing mental games similar to the ones she played on the people whose lives she was able to sort out .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: All of this is secondary however to Jeunet"s striking depiction of Paris as a rose - tinted , candy cane world , in which the clouds are shaped like bunnies and love conquers all .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: It is through this empty majesty of photography , production design , and one of the most adorably different leading ladies in the from of Tautou , that we allow ourselves to be pulled into this world .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: The film coasts along from one good deed to another , with one glorious shot after another , so detailed in its execution that just thinking about a scene later will make you wo nt to re - experience the film all over again .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: Certainly there are some minor flaws to the film , a little to sugary in some places ,

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: but nothing too distracting , and it certainly isn"t the dumbing down of foreign cinema that some critics hailed it as .

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: Amelie is nothing more than a sweet natured film about , for the most , a sweet natured character ,

title: The Fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain
review: and is a film so entertaining and enjoyable , that after viewing Amelie once you will no doubt be intoxicated by the joy that the film transmits . 5/5

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Jean - Pierre Jeunet is well known for his collaborations with Marc Caro , the results of which are displayed in the visually lavish but emotionally empty films of Delicatessen and The City Of Lost Children .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: They are fairytale films set in fantastical worlds .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: They are also dark movies .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Both of which I enjoy .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: What made the films overcome their lack of emotion for me was the strong atmosphere .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: And with Amelie , Jean - Pierre Jeunet has brought his skill to create such an atmpshere to a brighter kind of fairytale .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: And even a cynical moviegoer such as myself must admit it works wonders .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: The characters of Amelie inhabit some world located between the full fantasy world of Jeunets previous efforts and a real place .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Paris , as seen in Amelie , isn"t the real place .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: And many of the characters aren"t real people .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: They aren"t allowed to develop into real people .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: These are the main elements Jeunet brings along from his earlier films .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: On the other hand , he"s determined to create a main character with whom it"s easier to identify with than his usual protagonists ,

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: and even though Amelie is an introverted eccentric , she never becomes any less than a believable human being .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Most of this is of course thanks to the brilliant performance by Audrey Toutou .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: She"s an unusually charismatic presence in this film .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: And while she may be the heart , soul and title character of the film , the rest of the cast root their archetypes in real human emotion , creating a set of figures easy to connect with on an emotional level .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Jeunet has understood , fairytales aren"t merely about the magical woods , big dragons or the intellectual interpretation of its meanings , they"re about empathizing with the characters .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Jeunet also tries hard to bring some innovation into the genre of the romantic comedy .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: He does this by inserting streaks of fantasy , humour that actually is funny ( the suicide fish , anyone ? )

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: and every cinematic trick in the book .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Indeed , stylistically a film Amelie is strongly connected to is Fight Club .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: It takes the visual audacity of that film ,

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: but replaces its darkness and its cynicism by bright , vibrant colours and sheer happiness .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: And because it"s so honest and so incredibly funny , this feelgooder did something no Hollywood feelgooder could ever do : it actually made me feel good .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Good examples of extraordinary use of cinematic trickery abound in Amelie .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: But just when you think his box of tricks is going to overwhelm the underlying emotional story , Jeunet captures the emotion perfectly .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Easiest example : the wonderfully understated kissing scene .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: And Jeunet has also discovered to use his trickery for more than creating atmosphere ; he now uses them as storytelling tools .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face

review: The main points of criticism : sentimentality and right - wing propaganda / racism .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: The point about Amelie being sentimental is , I feel , utter rubbish .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Yes , it"s a happy film ,

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: and no , it has no cynicism about it whatsoever .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: But does Jeunet ever allow sickly saccharine cliches to enter the equation ? Does false emotion ever take over ? Definitely not .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: His Paris may be an imagined or rather fondly remembered one and not even related to the existing place , but"s it"s a fairytale to begin with , like his previous films .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: It doesn"t aim for realism .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: What Jeunet wants to do is reaffirm your belief in the fact that true love is out there and that little things can make a difference .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: All he wants you to do is to walk out of your cinema with a big happy smile on your face .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: Avoiding the harsher sides of daily life in order to achieve this is not sentimentality , it"s optimism .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: The second complaint involves apparent racism in the film , for while its Paris may be part fantasy , why are ethnic groups left out to such an extent ( the real Paris like all huge cities is a melting pot of cultures ) ? Honestly , this never ever occured to me while watching the film .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: There may be a rich vein of nostalgia throughout , a kind of conservative longing for simpler times gone by , for sure ,

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: but this is hardly enough to connect it to right - wing propaganda and certainly not racism .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: And he or she who looks closely WILL notice ethnic minorities in Jeunets Paris , that they are not among the protagonists was doubtlessly not something the makers were very conscious about .

title: Made me walk out with a huge almost ear-to-ear smile on my face
review: It"s about hiring the right people for the jobs , about creating an environment for the character of Amelie that may not be realistic but must be believable in a way .

review: It"s not about equal opportunity .

review: There"s something judgemental and unproductive in her actions against him .

title: Beautiful, as in "full of beauty"...
review: but not for the quantity of visual effects used ( which are plenty , very well done and very well placed in a time - space and script outline ) , nor for the shocking or violence - based manner of filming ( not present here and frequently found in many " box office hit " productions , mainly in the U. S. , although this way of " dazzling " film making is starting to make its way in Europe , not without major flops or hits - unreguarding the quality of the film contents ) .

title: Beautiful, as in "full of beauty"...
review: It is the subtlety with which the film came to life which shows an alternative - but not " out of this world " - way of filming , with a plain , yet excellent script , a very moving and concise sound track made by Yann Tiersen ( a young and very promising artist , as I listen ! ) , which is always in the mood of Monmartre -

title: Beautiful, as in "full of beauty"...
review: and you should visit the city listening to this sound track , if you may ... - , brilliant , almost surreal colors , and very good techniques either in montage or photography ... As far as the technical part is concerned .

title: Beautiful, as in "full of beauty"...
review: As far as the script is concerned , I can only speak for myself , thinking about the endless hours I spent watching my surroundings and thinking about what people do , how they act , what brings certain thoughts to their minds , laughing at myself for having thought or done certain things , being CURIOUS ... And that"s what it is all about , I guess ... Curiosity , holding to small pieces of what we learned throughout living , having small things to protect for ourselves , small thoughts , being with one foot on the ground , and the head within clouds , and feel like everything is found , not pursued , because all things found are also part of what we wanted to find , or else they wouldn"t be given the importance they have for us ... All of this is touching ,

title: Beautiful, as in "full of beauty"...
review: and Beautiful , as in " full of Beauty " ... Destiny ? Fate ? No , it"s humanity .

review: But maybe things aren"t that far apart .

First THE FORM : The film looks firstly like a surrealist collection of beautiful shots blended with an entrancing music ( the sound track of Yann Tiersen is a masterpiece ) .

title: A TRIBUTE TO DREAMERS AND A MANIFESTO TO HAPPINESS !

review: In this part the pace of the movie is much slower , the voice - over less prominent and some scenes even fall in repetition ( 2nd punishment of the grocer for example ) , which lead to the conclusion that the movie would have gained by more editing and deleting in this segment .

title: A charming, well-told story bound to impress.
review: LE FABULEUX DESTIN D"AMELIE POULAIN , or AMELIE , as us Americans refer to it , is the charming story of a woman named Amelie ( Audrey Tautou ) living in France and attempting to improve the lives of those around her .

title: A charming, well-told story bound to impress.
review: We are first told of Amelie"s upbringing , then shown her living her life , if somewhat unhappily , in Paris .

title: A charming, well-told story bound to impress.
review: Then we are shown Amelie"s attempts to improve her friends " lives ,

title: A charming, well-told story bound to impress.
review: and eventually her found love .
